loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Ms Raheela is a 40-years-old married woman. According to Raheela, she faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer and was not able to cover the expenses for the family alone. Raheela took the initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf foundation. She used that loan in the business of jewelry & bangles selling and steadily improved her business. She is very much satisfied from the support of Kashf foundation. 

Raheela is in her 8th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Now Raheela has applied for a loan of Rs 40000 to buy more packs of earrings, bracelets, necklaces and bangles in various designs and colors. Raheela enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She hopes to have more profits and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: buy jewelry to resell

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah used her previous loan to add more stock to her business which help her business to grow and right now her monthly income is KES 12000.  She is borrowing a loan of KES 80,000 which she intends to add more tables and chairs.  She will also purchase more foodstuff for her  restaurant.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en:
Sabha is a 38-year-old mother with four children.  She is married to Samer, who sells fruit and vegetables.  Her previous loan was taken to support her food store and bring more food products.  She is applying for another loan to support her husband in his fruits and vegetable sales business, as he sells the goods using his distribution truck around the neighborhood. 

Sabha's main reason for this loan is make some repairs on the distribution truck before the winter starts, and bring in more goods for her food store.

loans.use: repair her delivery truck and restock her store

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 30-year-old hard-working man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is running a video library, and he is aiming high to expand to other areas and educate his child. He faces the hardship of customers not returning the videos on time, and his plan is to trade in wholesale instead of hiring the videos out to retail customers.  Geofrey intends to use the loan to buy video tapes to sell.

loans.use: buy video tapes to sell

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 44 years old and is from the small village of Khelvachauri. He lives with his wife, 2 children and mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Amiran requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of the low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land where different kinds of vegetables are grown and 5 beehives with bee colonies. They sell the harvested products and cheese locally in an open market at a good price, but it is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistent poor category. 

Amiran requested loan from Credo to start-up a business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-up and re-startup with credits on soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Amiran will purchase a minibus. After the purchase, he will transport people from his village to Batumi and get a salary. He hopes his project will be profitable and the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase a minibus

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a very determined man with the urge to move forward. He has been involved in a retail activity for several years and he has gained enough experience. Thanks to the support given to him from the previous loan that helped him have more sales hence increased income.

Today, Harrison is asking for a new loan to invest in the purchase of more clothing to sell. He is a responsible man who promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 55 years old. He lives in the Senaki district in West Georgia with his wife and two children (2 and 14 years old).  Zurab requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was always rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Zurab's family is involved in a small-scale agricultural business. They run a family-owned poultry farm with 35 hens and sells on average 100-200 eggs per month.  Zurab also grows maize on the family-owned land and sells seasonally.  In addition, he works as a machine operator and gets a small monthly salary. But it is not enough to provide Zurab and his family with adequate living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistent poor category. 

Zurab has requested a loan from Credo to re-start his family business, which was stopped a couple of years ago because of financial problems. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-up and re-start-up with fewer conditions, to the country's rural poor. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, and they often do not have access to credit. 

With the credit, Zurab will renovate the shed and purchase chickens to start a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed, raise and sell the chickens for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: repair a shed and buy chickens

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet used her previous loan to add more stock to her business and right now her monthly income from the business is KES 30,000.

She is now borrowing her second loan of KES 80,000, which she intends to use to purchase seven bales of baking flour, Pampers, boxes of sugar and six crates of soda.

She plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to purchase new products in kitchenware and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase six bales of baking flour, Pampers, boxes of salt and four crates of soda.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta y compra de artesania,la socia vende muñecas,chompas,telares y gorros,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar telares,chompas y muñecas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita continues to buy and sell artisan goods, especially dolls, sweaters, textiles, and caps. She has had this business for 5 years now and it is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her artisan goods business. 

Margarita is requesting a loan to buy textiles, sweaters and dolls. She is very happy about the loan and promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy artisan textiles, sweaters and dolls to sell.

loans.name: El Cielito Group

texts.es: Elena es parte del grupo El Cielito, tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos jovencitos que estudian la secundaria, dice que ha sido difícil ser padre y madre para sus hijos ya que los jóvenes de ahora son muy rebeldes, dice que antes trabajaba en casas haciendo la limpieza pero al ver que estaba descuidando a sus hijos mejor decidió poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa y así estar más al pendiente de su hogar. Platica que ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para comprar productos que vende en su tiendita como azúcar, leche, huevos, arroz, sopas, galletas, refrescos, aceite comestible, sardinas, atún, papel higiénico, pañales y muchas cosas más las cuales surte en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a la de ella para que la gente no gaste en pasajes para ir a comprar hasta el pueblo lo mas indispensable. Dice que si le prestan el crédito su negocio mejorara y obtendrá ganancias con las cuales les podrá dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Maria Antonia, Rosa Gloria, Otilia y Lucia ellas invertirán sus créditos en  material para hacer bordados artesanales, compra de frutas y legumbres para su venta y artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elena is part of the "Little Sky Group." She is 39 years old and is the single mother of two children who are in middle school. She says it has been difficult to be both the mother and father of her children, since the kids are very rebellious right now. 

She says that before she was working as a housekeeper, but upon seeing that she wasn't taking good care of her children, she decided it would be best to start a small grocery store in her house and thereby stay more in charge of her home.

She says that right now she is asking for a loan to buy goods to sell in her small store, like sugar, milk, eggs, rice, soup, cookies, soft drinks, oil, sardines, tuna, toilet paper, diapers, and a bunch of other things that other stores in nearby towns sell. People don't want to spend money on travel to get these basics. 

She says that if they give her the loan her business will improve and she will be able to earn more, and with those earnings she can give her children a better quality of life. The other members are the group are named Maria Antonio, Rosa Glora, Otilia, and Lucia. They will invest their money in materials to make artisanal embroideries, in the purchase of fruit and vegetables to sell, and for goods to launch a grocery store.

loans.use: to launch her store that has groceries, like perishable items

loans.name: Emmahculate

texts.en:
Emmahculate is a 23-year-old farmer in Kitale County in Kenya where she lives. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years producing milk and maize, which she sells at the local market in her area. She runs an Mpesa business as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will give her more milk produce and earn her extra income, which will help in uplifting her living standards and boost her savings. She aspires to buy two more acres of land in the next five years.

High competition and lack of readily available markets are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal  Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza está conformado por 11 integrantes, personas muy trabajadoras, luchadoras con ganas de superación personal. Estos integrantes  padres de familia con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos pertenecen al municipio de malpaisillo lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona  agrícola  productiva. Matilde del Socorro es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga del buen funcionamiento y responsabilidad de los integrantes en cuanto a su cumplimiento en los pagos. Matilde tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos alimenticios de consumo diario para el hogar en cantidades pequeñas  como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, caja de fosforo, bolsitas de sopa magui, sobrecitos de café, sobres de shampoo, tomates, pan, leche, huevos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo para surtir su pequeño negocio y seguir trabajando para ganarse el pan de cada día de su familia. El banco comunal  Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza agradece a los inversionistas kiva  la ayuda que le brindan  a las personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Communal Bank is made up of 11 members, very hardworking people who strive to improve themselves personally.  These members are heads of family with children in their care.  They're from the town of Malpaisillo, known as a productive agricultural region.

Matilde del Socorro, the coordinator of the communal bank, is in charge of the bank's smooth management and of the members making their payments on time.  Her business is a "pulpería" located in her home.  A pulpería's a small store that sells small quantities of staple food items for the home: rice, beans, oil, matches, Maggi-brand soup packets, small envelopes of coffee and of shampoo, tomatoes, bread, milk, and eggs.

She needs the loan to invest in working capital to stock her small business and continue working to earn her family's daily bread.

Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Communal Bank thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent living.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simon is a 42-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children, who are all schooling. He has been farming for two years, producing maize, beans, and poultry products and he wants to venture into dairy farming. He runs a posho mill (where maize is ground) as an additional source of income.

Simon is requesting a KES 62,400 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will give him more milk produce and earn him extra income to assist in boosting his livelihood and paying for his children’s education. He aspires to have five acres of land and three dairy cows in the next five years. Poor prices and unreliable workers are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Meryam

texts.en:
Meryam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Meryam is a 21-year-old, married woman with no children yet. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all their costs. 

Meryam is a university student, specializing in Arts, who wants to complete her studies. She is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Meryam to do her homework and complete her reports. This will ensure a better future for Meryam and improve her conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: El Castillo 2 Group

texts.es:
El Grupo el castillo 2 esta integrado 10 personas con una actividad economica: 
Margarita venta de articulos para el hogar
Rosa venta de carme enchilada
Daniela venta de ropa
Carmela venta de calzado
Isabel venta de pollo
Procora venta de pollo
Norma venta de tacos
Eduardo cultivo de maiz
Lidia reposteria
 
Este grupo esta ubicado en una region cañera y la gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña de azucar

La señora Evarista tiene la edad de 48 años, estudio hasta la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Domingo que trabaja de Jornalero, tiene 2 hijos, Doña Evarista platica que desde 8 años inicio con la venta de pollo, tamales y mole porque quiere sacar adelante a sus hijas y apoyar a su esposo con los gasto de su hogar ya que con lo que gana su esposo no les alcanza para cubrir los gastos y asi apoyandose los dos se apoyan para sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella realiza su venta de  pollo, tamales y mole, se levanta muy temprano a limpiar y aliñar su pollo, despues pone su recipiente y sale a ofrecerlo con sus amigas y vecinas de su comunidad ademas comenta que su mole y tamales solo los prepara algunas veces a la semana pero tambien sale a ofrecerlos y dice que ya es muy conocida pues las personas le comprar muy bien sus tamales y su mole delicioso.

Doña Evarista necesita esta inversión para la compra de variedad de chiles, platanos, hojas de platanos, carne, tomates, aceite, masa, varidad de semillas, galletas, pollo en pluma, tortillas, chocolate y gas para posteriormente hacer sus deliciosos alimentos y ponerlos a la venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y pueda tener mas ganancias de las esperadas para que pueda ofrecerles a sus hijas una vivienda digna y que tiene deseos de ampliarla y continuar hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The “El Castillo 2” group is made up of 10 persons with the following businesses:

Margarita sells articles for the home
Rosa sells spiced meats
Daniela sells clothing
Carmela sells shoes
Isabel sells chicken
Procora sells chicken
Norma sells tacos
Eduardo raises corn
Lidia sells pastries
 
This group is located in the sugar cane region and its members raise and harvest sugar cane.
 
Evarista is 48 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Domingo who works as a laborer.  They have two children.  Evarista says that she has been selling chicken, tamales, and mole for the past eight years because she wants to get her daughters ahead and help her husband cover the household expenses.  This is how they support one another to get the family ahead.
 
She sells chicken, tamales, and mole and rises very early to clean and dress her chickens, places them in a container and goes out to offer it to her friends and neighbors in her community.  She also says that she only prepares her tamales and mole a few times a week and also goes out to sell them and says that she is well known and people buy her delicious tamales and mole.
 
Evarista needs to make this investment to buy peppers, plantains, banana leaves, meat, tomatoes, cooking oil, dough, various seeds, cookies, unplucked chickens, tortillas, chocolate, and gas so she can make and sell her delicious dishes.
 

She expects that this investment will help her business prosper and that she will have more earnings than expected so that she can offer her daughters a dignified home.  She wants to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

location.town: Tembladeras del castillo, Acatlan de Perez Figuero

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul used his previous loan to purchase more electronic goods for his shop, which increased his monthly income to KES 55,000.

He is now borrowing his third loan, which he intends to use to purchase more electronic equipment to sell.

He will expand his business with the anticipated profit from his business.

loans.use: To purchase electronic goods for sale.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie, 36, has been working hard managing her business for the past thirteen years. She is married and a mother of five children between the ages of 2 and 18. They stay in Buchanan with their mother and attend school. Mamie sells pepper, salt, palm oil, onions and vita in her community. She sells eleven hours a day, and transports her goods to her business area by taxi. She received the initial capital to start in this business from her aunty. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit when she sells. She uses the profit to buy more goods to improve her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more pepper, vita, palm oil, salt, onions and cooking oil for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a decent house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, vita, palm oil, salt, onions and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Roggers

texts.en:
Roggers is a 32-year-old, married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a parish chief for five years and with his salary saving, he has been able to buy land for farming. 

Just like all good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University and set up sustainable income-generating activities, like rentals, so as to secure their futures. Roggers intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: El Rincon Group

texts.es: Don Silvino es originario de una comunidad indígena mazahua en la cual la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías en ocoshal y a la elaboración de tejidos artesanales en lana. Don Silvino se dedica a la cría de borregos desde hace mas de 30 años ya que el no estudio porque sus padres no tenían recursos  y la escuela mas cercana le quedaba en aquel entonces muy retirada de su comunidad. El tiene ahorita 13 borregos y esta pidiendo un crédito para darle mantenimiento a su corral ya  que por las inclemencias del clima y por el mal estado de su corral ya se le han muerto varios borreguitos y que en su comunidad hace demasiado frio y cae hielo. Dice  que también le comprara alimento, vitaminas, desparacitantes para tenerlos en mejor estado y así venderlos a un mejor precio. Platica que en el mes de diciembre es cuando mejor ventas tiene y cuando son las clausuras de las escuelas ya  que  por las fiestas que hacen y las tradiciones de su comunidad hacen demasiada comida e invitan gente de otras comunidades  para festejar las fiestas. Don Silvino dice que si le prestan el crédito podrá mejorar su negocio y se siente agradecido con VisionFund. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Gonzalo, Albina y Eliseo ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de aguacate.
texts.en:
Don Silvino is from an indigenous Mazahua community, in which the majority of people work making handicrafts from the Ocoshal leaf and woven wool.

Don Silvino has made a living raising sheep for over 30 years. This is because he never studied, as his parents did not have the means to send him to school and the closest one was very far away from his community at that time.  

At the moment, he has 13 sheep and is requesting a loan to maintain their pen, because bad weather and its bad state of repair have already led to the death of several lambs, and it is cold and hails in his community. He also says that he will buy food, vitamins, and deparasiting treatments to keep them in better condition and thus sell them for a better price. 

He explains that in December he makes the most sales and the schools close. Due to the celebrations held and traditions of his community they make a lot of food and invite people from other communities to celebrate the holidays. Don Silvino says that if he gets a loan he can improve his business and he feels grateful to VisionFund. The other members of the group are called Gonzalo, Albina and Eliseo. They will invest their loans in buying manure and fertilizers to grow avocados.

loans.use: to buy sheep and food for them.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy used her previous loan to purchase mobile accessories to stock in her shop and right now, her monthly income from the business is KES 80,000.

She is now borrowing a loan of KES 60,000, which she will use to add more mobile accessories to her shop.

She will plow back the anticipated profit in the business.

loans.use: To purchase mobile accessories to stock in her M-pesa shop

loans.name: Rene Esteban

texts.es: René Esteban, 58 años de edad casado con tres hijos 23,25 y 25 todos ellos trabajan, El Sr. Rene es propietario de una unidad de transporte pesado con el cual brinda el servicio de transporte de carga de manera individual a productores, además cuenta con ingresos de la venta de leche, su comportamiento de pago ha sido muy bueno está muy agradecido con el apoyo que se le ha brindado con los créditos para fortalecer su negocio y se siente contento con los resultados que ha obtenido, Él solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas y otros , su meta es en un futuro remodelar su casa
texts.en: René Esteban is 58 years old and married with three children ages 23, 25 and 25.  They are all working.  René is the owner of a transportation vehicle, which he uses to provide transportation of cargo to producers. In addition, he counts on the income he receives from milk sales.  His payment record has been very good and he is very grateful for the support that the loans have offered him, enabling him to strengthen his business.  René feels content with the results he has obtained.  He is requesting this loan in order to purchase tires and other parts.  His future goal is to remodel his home.

loans.use: to purchase tires for the vehicle he uses for transportation and thus continue offering this service.

loans.name: Bramwel

texts.en:
Bramwel is a 32-year-old farmer in Kitale County in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who have not yet started school. He has been in farming for the past five years producing maize and milk, which he sells at the nearby market in his area.

He is requesting a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will provide him with more milk to sell and earn him extra income to help him uplift his living standards and pay for his children’s schooling in the future. He aspires to have six dairy cows in the next five years.

Competition and unreliable workers are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a hardworking, enterprising woman who tries to be the best mother she can be. She sells men's, women's, and children's clothing as a street vendor. She is well known to the people in the different neighborhoods and towns she travels to, and she has regular customers. She wants very much to succeed and has already managed to get herself out of harm's way. She has set goals to improve her life and that of her family. She is applying to Yehu for a loan to take advantage of an opportunity to buy a large quantity of clothing: blouses, shirts, khangas, shorts, and other items. She expects that her income will increase and that her life with her family will be better.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothing: blouses, shirts, khangas, shorts, and other items

loans.name: Santos Medardo

texts.es:
Santos Medardo de 33 años, casado con dos hijos menores de edad de 12,13 años, es originario de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente. Lugar que se destaca por ser una zona comercial productiva. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico Santos no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado ser ingeniero en sistema. 
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante, santos se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, desde hace 14 años que se dedica   dicha actividad, para brindarle estabilidad económica a sus hijos, y  poder proporcionarles  condiciones para formarlos en la vida y que sean personas de bien. Con mucho esfuerzo logro pagar su unidad de taxi. En la actualidad necesita el crédito para invertir en capital de trabajo  y darle mantenimiento a su unidad de taxi, como comprar llantas, aceite, y repuesto que necesita, para brindar un mejor servicios y obtener mejores ingresos. En un futuro no muy lejano su sueño es compra un terrero y poder darles a sus hijos un lugar propio donde vivir dignamente. Santos Medardo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
33-year-old Santos Medardo who is married with children aged 12 and 13 is from Chinandega, a place that is located in the occidental area. It is known for being a productive commercial zone. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, Santos was not able to get a degree, though he would have liked to study to be a systems engineer.
Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and his desire to get ahead, Santos provides a taxi service. He has been doing this activity for 14 years in order to provide financial stability for his children and to be able to give them the conditions to raise them well in life and for them to be good people. It was with a lot of effort that he managed to buy his taxi. Now, he needs the loan to invest in working capital and to provide maintenance to his taxi like buying tires, oil and a spare that it needs, in order to provide a better service and obtain greater income. In the not-so-distant future, his dream is to buy a piece of land and be able to give his children a place where they can live with dignity. Santos Medardo is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to provide maintenance to his taxi like buying tires, oil and a spare that it needs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 43-year-old farmer in Kitale county, in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children. Only one of the children is still schooling. David has been in farming for the past three years, producing milk, maize, and vegetables, which he sells at the local market in his area. He is a postmaster as an additional source of income.

David is requesting a KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will provide him with more milk produce and earn him extra income that will help him boost his living standards and pay for his children’s education. 

David hopes to have five, good-quality dairy cows in the next five years. Lack of a readily available market and poor roads are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nuestra Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUESTRA OPORTUNIDAD”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelba es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: licorería, costura de ropa, lencería, tienda de barrio, juegos electrónicos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelba es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de licores (licorería), cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al observar que es un negocio rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licores) que adquirirá de las negociantes al por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para su familia.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuestra Oportunidad" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the "Panamericana" regional office.  It is composed of six members and is overseen by a committee of directors where Nelba is the secretary.  The communal bank members are involved in varied businesses, including a liquore store, seamstress, lingerie store, neighborhood store, and selling electronic toys.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro-businesses of the members.  Nelba is one member.  She says this is her first cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined through the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution.  Presently, she has a business selling liquor (a liquor store).  She says that she learned this business through observation, and that it is a profitable business.

The loan that she will now take out is to grow her capital through the purchase of liquor.  She will buy the merchandise wholesale from businessmen and she will later sell it in her shop.  This form of work allows her to generate economic resources for her family.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training sessions.

loans.use: to buy liquor for her store.

loans.name: Jeys Junior

texts.es:
Jeys es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jeys se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir estudiando y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jeys trabaja como Auxiliar Contable en un estudio contable de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jeys se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una impresora, la cual le servirá de mucho para mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos académicos, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional y tener su propio estudio jurídico.
texts.en:
Jeys is a 20-year old young man who is single and lives in the town of Pucallpa with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person and has a great ambition of self-improvement. Thanks to his own effort and the support of his parents, Jeys is currently studying professional studies in Accountancy. In his spare time, he likes to continue studying and sometimes cooks delicious "chicharrones" to share with his family. 

By personal initiative and with great determination and dedication, Jeys works as an Assistant Accountant in an accounting office in his town. He works everyday for approximately 6 hours. He enjoys what he does and believes he does a good job as a result of his good performance and the friendliness he shows towards people. 

Jeys is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their financial support he will be able to buy a printer, which will significantly improve the quality of his academic work. He will continue to work hard to get ahead and accomplish his dream of becoming a good professional and having his own legal business.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 46-year-old man who owns a small restaurant where he makes sandwiches to sell for take away and delivery. He also has a couple of tables in the restaurant. Bilal now wants to expand his business and open a section for families by adding more tables to the place and employing more people. For that reason, he has applied for this loan to buy tables and buy more food products to be able to cover his customers' needs when they come to the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and more food products

loans.name: El Aguacate Group

texts.es: Michoacán es uno de los primeros estados a nivel mundial que se dedica a cultivar fruto de aguacate. Blanca comenta que el grupo tiene ese nombre porque lo que mas cultivan es ese fruto tan delicioso y hay bastantes viveros que se dedican a sembrar la semilla y a vender por mayoreo ese tipo de plantas. Blanca tiene 30 años y se dedica a cultivar hortalizas como rábanos, espinacas, cebollas, chile manzano y aguacate desde hace un año empezó con ese negocio  por que no le alcanzaba con lo que sacaba de la venta de cosméticos y perfumería por catalogo y mejor su esposo y ella empezar a cultivar hortalizas para venderlas en la central de abastos, dice que comenzó ese tipo de negocio para aprovechar un terreno amplio que tiene y entonces su esposo como sabe de cultivo  le empezó a ayudar y juntos sacar adelante a su familia, ella tiene una hija la cual estudia la primaria y es por eso que ella le echa muchas ganas para darle lo mejor. Dice que esta pidiendo el crédito para comprar semilla, abonos e insecticidas para mejorar sus frutas y legumbres y también para comprar planta de aguacate. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Angelina, Emilia, Brenda Guadalupe, Alondra, Juana, Yolanda, María Cristina, Alicia y Verónica, ellas invertirán sus créditos para la compra de artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en frutas y legumbres de temporada, material para hacer tabicón para vender, para la compra de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Michoacán is one of the first states worldwide that is dedicated to cultivating avocado fruit. Blanca says that the group has the name (El Aguacate - the avocado) because that is what they grow the most. It is a very delicious fruit. There are quite a few nurseries that are dedicated to planting the seed and that sell that type of plant wholesale.

Blanca is 30 years old and has been dedicated to growing vegetables like radishes, spinach, onions, Manzano chiles, and avocado for the last year, when she started her business. She started it because she didn't make enough from cosmetics and perfume catalog sales, and to help her husband. She began to grow vegetables and sell them in the market.

She says that she began this type of business to take advantage of the wide area that she has, and her husband has knowledge of crops. She began to help, and together, they're improve their family. She has a daughter which is in primary school, and she is eager to giver her the best.

She says that she is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to improve her fruits and vegetables, and also to buy an avocado plant. 

The other members of the group are called Angelina, Emilia, Brenda Guadalupe, Alondra, Juana, Yolanda, María Cristina, Alicia and Verónica. They will invest their credits to buy items to re-stock a grocery store, for seasonal fruits and vegetables, material to make bricks to sell, and to buy catalog cosmetics, clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to improve her fruits and vegetables, and also to buy an avocado plant.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 40-year-old man who is married with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. The main items that he sells are sugar, salt, and soap, among others. He has been in this trade for three years in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. Because his clients cannot easily travel to urban centers for his services, he monopolizes the area. In addition to the retail business, he practices farming for additional income. Peter is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана  -  женщина фермер.  С 2006 года занимается выращиванием огурцов, помидоров и поздних томатов.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и 15 -ти летняя дочь, которая учится в школе.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с одной теплицы, где выращивали молодой огурец.
Оксана решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы, агроволокно и капельную ленту.
В планах на будущее:  развивать теплицы.
В личных планах: достроить дом для проживания.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и агроволокна.
texts.en: Oksana is a  female farmer. Since 2006 she has grown cucumbers, tomatoes, and late-season tomatoes. Her husband and 15-year-old daughter, who is studying in school, help her manage the farm. She began developing her business with a greenhouse, where they grow young cucumbers. Oksana decided to buy film to cover her greenhouses, landscape fabric, and drip tape. She plans to build another greenhouse in the future. She also plans to finish building her house. She needs your help to pay for the film and the landscape fabric.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Gennadiy

texts.ru:
Геннадий  - фермер. С 2002 года занимается выращиванием огурцов  помидоров и поздних томатов.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с одной теплицы, где выращивали молодую капусту.
Геннадий решил приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы и  защиты огурца и помидора от холода и ветра.
В планах на будущее:  расширить количество теплиц.
В личных планах: покупка нового автомобиля, для транспортировки товара на рынок сбыта.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки.
texts.en: Gennadiy is a farmer. Since 2002 he has grown tomatoes, cucumbers, and late-growing tomatoes. His spouse helps him manage the farm. He began developing his farm by building a greenhouse where they grow a young cabbage. Gennadiy decided to buy film to cover greenhouses and protect the cucumbers and tomatoes from the cold and wind. He plans to increase the number of greenhouses he has in the future. He would also like to buy a new car to transport goods to market. He needs your help to buy the film.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Alexandr

texts.ru:
Александр  - фермер. С 2002 года занимается выращиванием огурцов и помидоров.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и 17-летняя дочь, которая учится в школе.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с одной теплицы где Александр выращивал огурцы.
Александр решил приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы, а также защитить огурец от холода и ветра, агроволокно и капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на будущие:  расширить теплицы, посадить виноград.
В личных планах: образование дочери, достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки, агроволокна и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Alexander is a farmer. Since 2002 he has grown cucumbers and tomatoes. His wife and 17-year-old daughter, who goes to school, help him manage the farm. He began developing his farm by building a greenhouse where Alexander grows cucumbers. Alexander decided to buy landscape fabric, drip tape for irrigation, and film to cover the greenhouses and protect the cucumbers from cold and wind. He plans to expand the greenhouse and plant grapes in the future. He would like to pay for his daughter's education and build a house. He needs your help to buy film, landscape fabric, and drip tape.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 22-year-old farmer in Kitale county, in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children. One of the children has started schooling. Elizabeth has been in farming for the past five years, producing milk, maize, beans, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells at the local market in her area. She runs a bakery as an additional source of income.

Elizabeth is requesting a KES 62,400 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This will provide Elizabeth with more milk for sale and earn her extra income which she will use to uplift her living standards and pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to buy another dairy cow in the next five years. Diseases and fluctuation of prices are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marylin De Fatima

texts.es: Marylin De Fátima, 43 años de edad, soltera con 3 hijos 19,21 y 23 años de edad todos estudian en la universidad, es propietaria de un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 4 años el cual conoce muy bien este negocio. Marylin ha logrado obtener una mayor clientela, ya que ellos saben los diferentes productos que les ofrece. Está muy contenta con el progreso que ha venido teniendo con los créditos que se le han otorgado para mejorar su negocio. Ella nos está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de Juguetes, fajas, relojes, gorras, calculadoras, calzado, perfumes, ropa en general, prendas de oro y plata entre otros productos. Ella por lo momentos desea  terminar de construir su casa que ya la tiene bastante avanzada.-
texts.en:
Marylin De Fátima is 43 years old, single, and has three children aged 19,21 and 23, who are all studying at university. 

She has owned a business selling general merchandise for the past four years. She knows this business very well. Marylin has managed to attract a lot of customers, since they know about the different products she offers them. She is very happy about the progress she has made with the loans, which she was given to improve her business.

She is requesting a loan from us to buy toys, belts, watches, hats, calculators, shoes, perfumes, general clothing, and silver and gold jewelry among other items. 

At the moment, she wants to finish building her home, which is already well underway.

loans.use: to increase her stock of toys, watches, sunglasses, clothes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Maximina

texts.es:
Maritza, se ha decidido por continuar trabajando con créditos, para el fortalecimiento del negocio, desea realizar una inversión de ropa nueva, blusas, vestidos, faldas, short, pantalones, y otro tipo de prendas, que le permitan realizar una mejora al inventario y poder atender las demandas de los clientes, ella siempre mantiene el negocio de boquitas y tipicos, como turrones, yuca, etc.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior le permitió generar ganancias y poder finalizar la construcción de la casa, a través de su esfuerzo en el negocio y ahorrando, está muy contenta de tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Maritza has decided to continue working with Kiva loans in order to improve her business. She wants to make a new investment in clothes: shirts, vests, skirts, shorts, pants, and other types of garments, that will allow her to improve her inventory and be able to fulfill the demands of her customers. She also sells local dishes out of her business, like sweets, yuca, etc.
She says that the previous loan allowed her to make a greater income and to be able to finish the construction of her house. Through her efforts in her business and savings, she is very content to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy shirts, vests, skirts, shorts, and pants

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Angelica tiene la edad de 20 años, estudio la secundaria y esta casada con Jonathan que trabaja como obrero, ellos tienen un pequeño bebe. 

Angelica nos platica que desde muy pequeña en casa de sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para ganarse la vida y ahora que se ha casado y con su bebe, queria buscar nuevas oportunidades para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida asi que inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio realizando ventas de calzado con sus amigas y poco a poco ha ganado mas clientes, ella realiza sus ventas en su tiempo libre y lo que mas le gusta de su pequeño negocio es que ha hecho buenos amigos y ha conocido mucha gente.

un credito de VisionFund le dara la oportunidad de comprar variedad de zapatos para continuar realizando sus ventas. 

A futuro le gustaria que su negocio progrese mas y iniciar ha vender mas productos para que sus ganancias aumenten.

Angelica pertenece a un grupo integrado por 10 personas de nombre Las Emprendedoras el cual esta ubicado en una comunidad donde la principal fuente de empleo es el Ingenio La Margarita. Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Elvia Maria venta de carne 
Maria Guadalupe venta de antojitos
Teresa de Jesus venta de cosmeticos
Blanca Estela venta de antojitos 
Sonia venta de ropa 
Juana venta de antojitos 
Maria Susana venta de ropa 
Maria Yolanda venta de oro laminado y colchas
Lidia venta de telas y servicio de costura
texts.en:
Angelica is 20 years old. She completed high school and is married to Jonathan, who is a laborer. They have a small baby. 

Angelica tells us that from a young age in her parent's home, they taught her to work to get ahead in life. Now that she is married and with her baby she wants to look for new opportunities to give her son a better quality of life. So she started to work in her own business selling shoes with her friends. Little by little she has gained more customers. She makes her sales in her free time and what she likes most about the small business is that she has made good friends and met many people. 

A loan from VisionFund gives her the opportunity to purchase a variety of shoes in order to continue making sales. In the future she would like her business to progress and to begin selling more products in order to increase her income. 

Angelica belongs to a group made of 10 people by the name of The Entrepreneurs, which is located in a community where the principal source of employment is Ingenio La Margarita. The members of the group are:

Elvia Maria - sells meat
Maria Guadalupe - sells snacks
Teresa de Jesus - sells cosmetics
Blanca Estela - sells snacks
Sonia - sells clothes
Jana - sells snacks
Maria Susana - sells clothes
Maria Yolanda - sells laminated gold and blanket
Lidia - sells cloth and sewing services

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 43-year-old married man and a father to one son. Mahmoud and his wife are both employed and get low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs.

Mahmoud wants to improve his house's condition by making some renovations, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to cover all these costs, so he is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing paints and necessary materials and hiring workers to paint the house.

This has allowed Mahmoud to live in better home conditions together with his family.

Mahmoud appears in the picture.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy paint to paint the house

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 40-year-old married woman with a three-year-old girl. Recently, Hiyam has started buying and selling cosmetic products at home but in small quantities. She has applied for this loan to buy a variety of cosmetic products and make-up to increase her profits in hopes that one day she can open a beauty salon with a section for selling cosmetics in it.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetic products and make-up

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a 30-year-old woman. She is a single lady who lives in a rental house. She is obliged to work continually as she is responsible for helping her parents and siblings. Carolyne started to sell clothes from a small stall. She provides her customers with good quality products at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, even though she most wishes to enhance her standard of living. That’s why she’s asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner Yehu to purchase a new collection of clothes. In the near future, Carolyne wishes to open her own clothing shop and maybe hire employees to help her achieve the work tasks and therefore earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.ru:
Зинаида  -  женщина фермер. С 2007 года занимается выращиванием огурцов  и помидоров.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает 25 -ти летний сын.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с трех теплиц, где выращивали молодой огурец.
Зинаида решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы для защиты огурца и помидора от холода и ветра, агроволокно, капельную ленту.
В планах на будущее:  развивать теплицы,  купить мотоблок.
В личных планах: купить дом для проживания.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и агроволокна.
texts.en: Zinaida is a female farmer. Since 2007 she has grown cucumbers and tomatoes.  Her 25-year-old son helps manage the farm.  She began developing the farm by building three greenhouses where they grow young cucumbers. Zinaida decided to buy landscape fabric, drip tape, and film to cover the greenhouses to protect her cucumbers and tomatoes from the cold and wind. She plans to build another greenhouse and buy a walk-behind tiller. She would also like to buy a house to live in. She needs your help to buy the film and landscape fabric.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: El Mangito Group

texts.es:
El mangito es el nomre de un grupo integrado por 10 personas. Ellos dedidieron dar este nombre a su grupo porque es el lugar donde se reunen hay un arbol de Mangos. Cada integrante de ellos lleva a cabo una actividad economica.
Ambrosio-Refrescos
Mario-Refrescos
Pablo-refrescos
Nayrobi-panaderia
Margarita-Articulos para el hogar
Ana Esther-abarrotes
Judith-antojitos
Nallely-cosmeticos
Teofila-carniceria
Porfirio-tortillas

Ana Esther tiene la edad de 49 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y esta casada con Salomon que se dedica al trabajo de campo, ella platica que hace un poco mas de un año abrió en su hogar una tienda de abarrotes con la intecion de ganar un poco de dinero extra para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que todos los días se vende. Ella abre todos los días su negocio de 6 de la mañana a 8 de la noche , también nos dijo "yo creo que con mi tienda también brindo un servicio a mi pueblo por aquí hay poco comercio y la gente busca donde hacer compras por eso surto mi negocio con todo de un poco".
Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabón, frituras, productos en latados, jugos, refrescos, dulces y galletas para resurtir en el negocio.

Ana Esther quiere a futuro que su  negocio prospere y ampliarlo para surtir mas.
texts.en:
El mangito (The little mango) is the name of this 10 person group. They decided on this group name because at the place they meet, there is a mango tree.
Each member has an economic activity.
Ambrosio- snakcs
Mario- snacks
Pablo- snacks
Nayrobi- bakery
Margarita- items for the home
Ana Esther- groceries
Judith- sweets
Nallely- cosmetics
Teofila- butcher
Porfirio- tortillas

Ana Esther is 49 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study, and is married to Salomon, who is dedicated to field work. She says that a little more than a year ago she opened a grocery store in her home with the intention of earning a little extra money to help her husband with the household expenses.

She is very happy with her business and sells every day. She opens her business everyday at 6 in the morning until 8 at night. She also said "I believe that with my store I also provide a service to my village. Here, there is little trade and the people are looking for places to make purchases. That is why I supply my business with a little bit of everything."

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, broth, soap, fried foods, canned goods, juices, soft drinks, sweets and cookies to re-stock her business.

For the future, Ana Esther wants her business to prosper and to expand to supply more goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, broth, soap, fried foods, canned goods, juices, soft drinks, sweets and cookies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 48-year-old farmer in Kitale County in Kenya where she lives with her husband and five children who are all schooling. She has been in farming for the past 20 years, producing maize, beans, milk and sweet potatoes, which she sells at the local market in her area. She runs a mini-hotel as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She will sell the milk and earn extra income, which will help her boost her family’s income and living standards and pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to buy two more dairy cows in the next five years.

Diseases and fluctuation of prices are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Abduljaleel

texts.en:
AbdulJaleel is 61 years old and married. He is a father of three boys and one girl.
 
AbdulJaleel has a clothing store in an active area, from which he is supporting the family and paying for his children's school. Now, AbdulJaleel has applied for a loan to buy a new collection of winter clothes that he doesn't have to add variety and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Sabta

texts.en: Sabta is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and four children. To support the family financially, Sabta's husband works at two jobs while she works in their small-sized food store selling snacks and basic food products to families in the neighborhood. Sabta has applied for a loan to bring in some goods requested by her customers and to add a better quality of products to her store.

loans.use: to bring in some requested goods

loans.name: Momen

texts.en:
Momen is a 25-year-old young married man with no children yet. For the past three years, he has been selling home products from his store, which is situated in a good location in the center of the market and is well known among customers. His business is profitable and is his only source of income; however, it needs more support from time to time to cover some costs.

Momen is requesting a Murabaha loan from FATEN (see below) to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of home products to sell. This will increase sales and improve his income positively. Momen is photographed inside his store. About Shariah-compliant lending: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Seccion 7 Group

texts.es:
El grupo sección  7, esta ubicada en una comunidad donde la principal actividad económica es la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar y su gente es muy amable, trabajadora y alegre. Este grupo esta integrado por 5 personas:
Roman-Venta de refrescos
Maria Elizabet-venta de calzado
Virginia-venta de tacos
Ana Bertha- Venta de ropa
Serafin-venta de refrescos

Roman tiene la edad de 36 años, es soltero y estudio preparatoria . El platica que hace mas de 15 años tiene en un pequeño local en su hogar una refresqueria la cual abre todos los días de 9:00 de la mañana hasta que se va el ultimo cliente.

Cuando el inicio este negocio  fue porque en su pueblo hay pocas fuentes de empleo y el quería ayudar a su madre y darle una mejor y darle una mejor calidad de vida.

El invertirá este crédito en la compra de variedad de refrescos, jugos, galletas, dulces y frituras para resurtir su refresqueria.

El quiere a futuro hacer una pequeña remodelacion de su negocio y seguir apoyando a su madre.
texts.en:
The group, section 7, is located in a community where the dominant economic activity is the planting and cultivation of sugar cane. The people are very friendly, hardworking and cheerful. This group is composed of 5 people:
Roman- Sells soft drinks
Maria Elizabet- Sells footwear
Virginia- Sells tacos
Ana Bertha- Sells clothing
Serafin- Sells soft drinks

Roman is 36 years old. He is single and finished high school. He says that for more than 15 years, he has had a small place in his home, a snack bar, which is open every day from 9 in the morning until his last customer.

When he began this business, it was because his town had few sources of employment and he wanted to help his mother and give her better and improve their quality of life.

He will invest the credit in the purchase of a variety of soft drinks, juices, cookies, sweets and fried foods to re-stock his snack bar.

For the future, he wants to do a small remodel of his business and continue to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks, juices, cookies, sweets and fried foods.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 38, is from Kutaisi district. He lives with his wife and 2 children. David requested a  loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the small amount earned by David, who works as an artisan. It is hardly enough for food for a four member family. According to Credo's estimations, his family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved because of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, David will purchase a truck. After purchasing this truck, he plans to trade vegetables. He will buy vegetables from wholesalers then transport and resell at better price. This will increase his family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a truck and start trading vegetables.

loans.name: Alondra Group

texts.es:
Alondra es un grupo integrado por 7 personas trabajadoras y amables este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad cuya unica fuente de empleo es el campo en la recoleccion de resinas de arbol de hule y cultivo y siembra de caña.

Doña Ausencia desde hace mas de 4 años tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa, Ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para poder contribuir con el gasto del hogar.

Doña ausencia tiena la edad de 31 años, estudio solo primaria, esta casada con Jose  y tiene 3 hijos.

lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que no solo gana su propio dienero sino que esta enseñando a sus hijos que  en la vida se sale adelante trabajando ya que algunas ocasiones ellos la ayudan a despachar.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de productos enlatados, aceite, jugos, frijol, sal, arroz, sopa, azucar, arina, dulces, refresco, chile, tomates y cebolla para resurtir su negocio.

Ella espera a futuro su negocio siga creciendo y surtirlo mas  para dar a su familia una mejor vida.  

Este grupo agradece a Vision Fund por el apoyo que les brinda con estos prestamos.

Los demaas integrantes del grupo son:

Alberta venta de pollo
Maria Elizabeth Venta de refrescos y dulces 
Maricela venta de pasta de mole
Piedad venta de ropa interior
Adan venta de pan 
Alberta venta de dulces
texts.en:
Alondra is a group made up of seven hardworking and kind people. This group is located in a community whose only source of employment is collecting resin from rubber trees and cultivating and planting sugarcane. 

Ausencia has had a small grocery shop in her home for over four years. She decided to set up her own business in order to contribute to household expenses.

Ausencia is 31 years old, was educated only to primary school level, is married to Jose and has three children. 

Her favorite thing about her business is that she not only earns her own money but that she is teaching her children that in life you succeed by working, because they sometimes help her to sell.

She will invest this loan in buying a variety of canned products, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, sweets, soft drinks, chillies, tomatoes and onions to restock her business.

She hopes that in the future her business continues to grow, and that she can stock it with more products to give her family a better life. 

This group is grateful to Vision Fund for the support it gives them through these loans.

The other members of the group are: Alberta, who sells chicken; Maria Elizabeth, who sells soft drinks and sweets; Maricela, who sells Mole paste; Piedad, who sells underwear; Adan, who sells bread, and Alberta, who sells sweets

loans.use: to buy a variety of canned products, oil, juices, beans, salt, rice, soup, sugar, flour, sweets, soft drinks, chillies, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en: Buthaina is a 38-year-old married woman. Her husband is a police officer and they have a 2-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son. Buthaina has a small beauty salon in Al-Mafraq. She wants to provide other services besides hair dressing and has decided to start offering facial treatment services. Buthaina did a lot of searching for good products to use in her salon and has now applied for this loan to buy facial treatment masks and hair treatment products.

loans.use: to buy facial treatment masks and hair treatment products

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza, 38 years old, is from the small village of Tskaltubo. He lives with his wife, 2 children and his mother. On several occasions, Zaza has requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but has had no success. His loan requests were always rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's only source of income is from agricultural activities. They have a cow, whose milk is used in dairy products, which they sell locally in an open market at a good price. However, it is hardly enough to feed the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zaza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative through Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Zaza will use this loan to purchase tires and an accumulator for his truck. After fixing up his truck, he will be able to get orders and transport goods. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tires and an accumulator for his truck

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en: Jamil is a 32-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is married and has 5 children. Jamil operates a business buying and selling food. His business is located along a busy street, thus attracting many customers. Jamil has been able to use his business proceeds to pay school fees for his children. He obtained his capital from a hide and skins business that he still operates. Jamil hopes to open new outlets in other trading centers despite the challenge of capital. Jamil intends to use the loan to buy products such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia tambien sigue vendiendo productos de libreria como cuadernos,libros y lapiceros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite y cuadernos,libros y lapiceros.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
texts.en:
This member continues to run her grocery store and sells primary needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She has been in this business for eight years and things are going very well for her.  She’s had the business for eight years and works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She also continues selling stationary items, such as notebooks, books, and pencils.  She is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, notebooks, books, and pencils.

She is grateful and values this loan that will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54-year-old farmer in Kitale county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children, three of them still in school. She has been farming for the past twenty years, producing milk, maize and beans, which she sells at the local market. Margaret runs a hotel as an additional source of income.

Margaret wants to venture into poultry farming. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. She will sell the poultry products and earn extra income to help her increase her livelihood and pay for her children’s schooling. Margaret's major farming challenges are poor transport networks and high competiton. She aspires to buy another dairy cow in the next five years. Margaret hopes Juhudi Kilimo will introduce school fees loans in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer humilde nacida en al paramo de la ciudad de Ambato, Rosa tiene 50 años es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 13 años, ella sigue trabajando airosa y con mucha fuerza, Rosa  se define como una persona muy reservada, alegre, Rosa ama mucho a su hijo y le encanta el campo, es por ello que desde pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de dos vaconas para la crianza y cuando ya estén las harán reproducir y se dedicaran a la distribución de leche, Rosa comenta que el trabajo del campo es sacrificado pero lo hace con amor  ya que su hijo la ayuda y pone muchas ganas para brindarle a su hijo de amor y cubrirle de todo lo el necesite.
El sueño que doña Rosa tiene es el tener una pequeña finca con muchas cabezas de ganado para ser distribuidora de leche y vender en los mercados y en las comunidades aledañas donde ella vive.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is a humble women born in the moor of of Ambato. Rosa is 50 years old, is a single monther and his a child that is 13 years old. She continues working gracefully and with much strength. Rosa defines herself as a very reserved person and happy person. Rosa loves her son very much and also loves the countryside. It is for that reason that since a small girl she has been in agriculture and the raising of animals.
The loan requested of FODEMI will be invested in the purchase of two cows to raise and when they are able to reproduce they will be dedicated to the distribution of milk. Rosa says that the farm work is sacrificial, but she does it with love since her son helps her and it provides good income to her loving son and covers all the necessities.
The dream that Rosa has is to have a small farm with many cattle for being a distributor of milk and selling in the markets and in the surrounding communities where she lives.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 2 cows for raising and reproduction.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, 40 years old, lives in a small village in the Tetritskaro District with his wife and two children (5 and 22 years old). The family's only source of income is Rashid's monthly salary working locally as a shepherd.

Rashid requested a loan to start up a dairy farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative through Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Rashid will use this loan to purchase a milk cow, which he will place in the old cattle shed located in his yard. Rashid will start the production of cheese and sell it at the local open market. The family's income will increase by 150-200 Laris, a 45–60% increase. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz, 61 years old, is married to Catherine and they have been blessed with four children, aged 22, 20, 17 and 4 years. Boaz has been a dairy farmer for 28 years and his current monthly income is KES 9,000.

Boaz is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase more dairy cows. He plans to reinvest the profit in the business. This is Boaz' second loan and he successfully repaid his previous one. His hopes and dreams are to continue with his dairy farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 28-year-old businessman who is married to Ruth, a businesswoman. They are blessed with one child, aged 12 years. Stephen has been running a bookshop business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Stephen is applying for his fourth loan with KADET LTD, having repaid the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy more textbooks and exercise books to sell. Stephen will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his child. Stephen's hopes and dreams are to expand his business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more textbooks and exercise books.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 22 years old. She is married with two children ages 2 1/2 years and 2 months. Her husband is a businessman who sells cloth. She has been in the clothing sales business for four years. She wants a loan to buy more cloth for tailoring. With the profit she will buy food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret used her previous loan to purchase four bales of wheat flour and maize flour, and bar soaps for her retail shop.

Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 6,000. She is now borrowing KES 60,000 to buy four bales each of wheat flour and maize flour, and bar soaps to sale.

loans.use: To purchase four bales each of wheat flour and maize flour, and bar soaps to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 33 years old. She is married with three children ranging in age from 1 to 8. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in the retail clothing business for six months. She wants a loan to buy more clothes for sale. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Drocela

texts.en: Drocela is 31 years old. She is married with one child who is 6 years old. Her husband is a soldier. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more bedsheets and window curtains. With the profit she will finish her house.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets and window curtains for sale.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 20 and youngest is 13. Her husband is a builder. She has been in business for 15 years. She wants a loan to buy more bed sheets. The profit will pay for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 27 años de edad, es un ejemplo vivo de que para salir adelante lo único indispensable son las ganas de querer hacerlo. Cuenta que cuando terminó el bachillerato su abuelo le prestó un local para que montara su propio negocio y con sus ahorros decidió crear una miscelánea, en la cual labora diariamente de nueve de la mañana a nueve de la noche. 
Marisol es madre soltera de una niña de seis años de edad, a la cual puede dedicarle el tiempo necesario gracias a que labora como independiente. “Esta es una de las grandes ventajas” manifiesta ella. Su mayor sueño es poderle ofrecer a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y acceso a la educación. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos de papelería con el fin de poder atender la demanda de la temporada escolar y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marisol is 27 years old. She is a living example that willpower is the only thing in life that you need to move forward. 

She says that when she finished her bachelor´s degree, her grandfather loaned her a place to start her own business. With her savings, she decided to open up a corner shop, where she works laboriously everyday from 9:00 in the morning to 9:00 at night. 

Marisol is a single mother with a 6 year-old daughter. Thanks to her self-employment she can dedicate as much time as necessary to her. "This is one of the greatest advantages," she says. 

Her dream is to offer her daughter a higher quality education and life. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy stationary materials so she can meet the demands of the school season and increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy stationary materials for her corner store.

loans.name: Mujeres En Fuerza Y Unión Group

texts.es: Circe es una chica con ganas de salir adelante, ella es originaria de una localidad donde hay  varias tradiciones y hacen fiestas de pueblo muy bonitas y pintorescas. Circe es parte del grupo llamado Mujeres en Fuerza y Unión, platica que una conocida de ella perteneciente al grupo fue quien la invito para que pudiera hacer su propia estética ya que ella estudio una carrera técnica de cultora de belleza en una población cercana a la de ella.
