El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de herramienta para la difusión de CD’s (compra de TV) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos económicos para su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The "FLOR NACIENTE" communal bank is about to begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de los Andes.  The group is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors chaired by Daniela.  The businesses run by the communal bank's members are wide-ranging and include: toy sales, CD sales, food sales, chicharrón (pork crackling) sales, sewing, fruit sales, sales of Avon products.  

The loan will benefit small micro entrepreneurs, one of whom is Daniela.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year and a half, having been invited to join by her mother, who is also a member of the group.  She currently runs a CD shop and says that she set up the business when she saw the work her mother was doing.  She believes that it is a profitable business and she runs it single-handedly.  

She will use the loan to improve her equipment for playing CDs (a television) which she will buy in the city of El Alto and then install in her shop.  This type of work enables her to generate an income for her family, as she is the single mother of one child.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training on health-related issues.

loans.use: to buy a television

loans.name: Las Rosas Del Tolar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS DEL TOLAR”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de leche, venta de pollo a ala brosthes, chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Lidia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación del asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche, da a conocer que este negocio lo heredó de sus papás ya que siempre trabajaron en estos negocios.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas, por mayor,  y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido en la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.

En la fotografía no se encuentran Luisa y Jorge, ya que tuvieron que ir al recojo de sus ganados.
texts.en:
The “Las Rosas Del Tolar” communal bank is in its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya center.  It’s made up of ten members and directed by a board of directors where Lidia serves as the president.  The members are involved in different businesses, such as cheese sales, milk sales, broasted chicken, and driver.

The is loan will benefit the small businesses, including Lidia, who has been with Pro Mujer for three years, having joined on the invitation of an advisor who visited her her home.  She sells milk and inherited this business from her parents.
 
This loan will allow her to buy cattle from the surrounding communities, raise them, and sell them on order from El Alto.  This type of work will allow her to earn income to support her household.  She is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the attention.

Luisa and Jorge are missing from the photograph because they had to pick up their livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Porteñitas De Lanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORTEÑITAS DE LANZA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez y seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos y golosinas, venta de comida, venta de tarjetas de teléfono, venta de pan, venta de mandiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Elena es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que la fue a visitar. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, cuenta que hace años aprendió este negocio lo heredó de su madre, ya que ella trabajaba anteriormente en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
“Porteñitas de Lanza” is a Communal Bank that will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. It is composed of sixteen members, guided by a directive board presided over by Elena. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as selling soft drinks and snacks, selling food, selling phone cards, selling bread and selling aprons.

Elena is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Elena says this is the first time she enters Pro Mujer, having been invited by a promoter of the institution who has come to visit her. She currently runs a food selling activity, and she told us she has learned this many years ago and that she has inherited her food stall from her mother, who had previously been engaged in the same activity.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying rice, noodles and oil. She will buy these items from wholesale retailers in the town of El Alto, to then prepare food to sell in her stall. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her household as much as she can, as she is single and she has a son.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she like the savings.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Bertty

texts.es: Betty vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande y se dedica al comercio desde hace 24 años, cuando decidió apoyar la gestión de su hogar, buscando aumentar el bienestar de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos hoy en las edades de 21 a 27 años.  Desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche,  Betty permanece trabajando, con el fin de lograr mayores ingresos que le permitan hacer crecer su negocio y con ello sus ingresos. Ella  vende hoy no solamente mercancía variada especialmente ropa, sino también tiene una refresquería donde vende gaseosas, té, entre otras bebidas; maneja ventas de contado y a crédito en un mayor volumen, y compra a grandes proveedores,  que le ofrecen buenos descuentos y oportunidades de dar los mejores precios a su clientela. En la actualidad se acerca la época de mayor movimiento comercial del año y debe estar preparada para atender la demanda  y para responder a su clientela y generar más ingresos con su trabajo. Esta e la razón por la cual acude a su primer credikiva y tercero que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, blusas, gaseosas y refrescos en general; con su credikiva bien invertido, el éxito de éste, estaría asegurado y Betty estaría cumpliendo poco apoco sus sueños de prosperidad, que no es otro que ver crecer su negocio y mantener siempre fuentes de financiación,  que le permitan lograrlo, como la que hoy obtiene a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su tercer financiamiento.
texts.en:
Betty lives in the municipality of Sabanagrande. She has worked in trade for 24 years. She decided to support the management of her home, looking to improve the well-being of her family, which is made up of her spouse and three children who are between 21 and 27 years old. 

Betty works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m., with the goal of earning a higher income which will allow her to grow her business and earnings. She sells varied merchandise, especially clothing, and now she also has a refreshment stall where she sells soda, tea, and other beverages. She sells large quantities of beverages in cash and credit. She buys from large suppliers who offer her good discounts and the opportunity to give the best prices to her clients.

The most important commercial period of the year is coming, and Betty should be prepared to fulfill the demand and respond to her clients in order to generate more income with her work. Therefore, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, which is her third with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use this loan to buy blouses, soda, and other soft drinks. With her Kiva loan well invested, she will ensure success and achieve her dream of prosperity little by little. She dreams of seeing her business grow and maintaining sources of financing which allow her to achieve her goals, such as the opportunity she has now through her third credit with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of soft drinks and clothing.

loans.name: Policarpo

texts.es: Policarpo de 69 años, para su tradicional negocio familiar, con un credikiva  compró de contado, retazos de telas en los talleres, que le pidieron las empresas industriales  que a él le compran. Su inversión fue exitosa porque logró incrementar su producción y continuar su crecimiento empresarial. En la actualidad está aplicando un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará retazos en mayor cantidad, aprovechando que los pequeños talleres aumentaron su producción  en el mes de Noviembre y Diciembre y la sobreoferta le da la oportunidad de obtener buenos precios, que mejoran su competitividad en el mercado. Su éxito  en el negocio,  consiste en que conoce muy bien el mercado y los picos de la oferta y la demanda, en los cuales  es propicio  hacer su mejor inversión,  vender más y proponer precios muy competitivos. Su sueño de prosperidad es continuar esforzándose para aumentar cada vez más la calidad de vida de su familia y  es muy seguro  que así será con su esfuerzo persistente y de la mano de Dios..
texts.en: Policarpo is 69 years old. In his traditional family business, he used a Kiva loan to pay cash for fabric remnants from the workshops, to fill his orders from industrial businesses. His investment was successful, because he managed to increase his production and continue his business growth. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan, with which he will buy remnants in greater quantity, taking advantage of the increased production in the small workshops in the months of November and December. The oversupply gives him the opportunity to obtain good prices, which improve his competitive position in the market. His success in the business consists of his knowing the market and the peaks of supply and demand very well and when it is propitious to make his best investment, to sell more and to set very competitive prices. His dream of prosperity is to continue striving to increasingly improve the quality of life of his family, and it is assured that this will be with his persistent effort and from the hand of God.

loans.use: to buy remnants in greater quantity to make industrial mats

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan, 33 years old, lives with his family in the Selenge province, located north in Mongolia. From November, 2011 to December, 2012 he has worked as an operator in coal mine. When the coal mine collapsed and stopped its operation, he began rendering taxi service to people who lives in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The taxi he uses for service belongs to his friend. Also he is living temporarily in that friend’s home and he is feeling he is such a burden to his friend. His official residence belongs to Selenge province and now he is temporarily residing in his friend's house on plot of land.

So he is requesting a loan of 5300000 MNT to purchase an automobile which is powered by an electric motor. Electric cars contribute to cleaner airs because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the on-board source of power, such as particulates, volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. By taking the loan he can purchase his electric car and can use it for taxi service without using his friend’s car. Most importantly the car he purchases will contribute greatly to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Altantsag

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsag, 27 years old, lives with her parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has undergone vocational training and now works as a receptionist in an international organization. Her father drives a truck in a transportation business entity.

In order to increase her income, she wants to run her own business. So, she is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to purchase coal from her brother at a low price and she wants to sell it at the retail price of 1,600 MNT per bag. Even though she has no experience in selling coal, her parents have sold coal several times. While she is away on work, her mother will sell coal for her. Altantsag is a very hardworking individual who is striving for a better life.

loans.use: to sell charcoal to local residents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Maria Dalila

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciuadad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla mucho la agricultura y sus pobladores tienen un don para la preparacion de platillos ya que lo hace de manera muy deliciosa. Maria es madre de 2 hijas de 15 y 17 años quienes son el regalo mas garnde que Dios le haya podido dar yu sobre todo son la razon por la cual ella lucha cada dia para poder ofrecerles una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor. 
Dia con Dia Maria trabaja en un centro medico de la ciudad, ya que ella es enferemera tecnica, ella labora alrededor de 12 horas al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que ella es madre soltera; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo proque es responsable y porque desde pequeña siempre quiso ayudar a las personas.

maria esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra solventar los gastos de estudios de su mayor hija ya que ha ingresado a un instuituto de la ciudad y tiene que pagar la matricula y los gastos de  inscripcion; de esta manera podra ofrecer a su hija una educacion superios y seguuir luchando por hacer relidad su mas grande sueño:" Darles una profesion a sus hijas y poder mejorar su calidad de vida".
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its very warm and welcoming climate. Consequently agriculture thrives there and residents have a flair for preparing very tasty dishes.

Maria is the mother of two daughters, who are 15 and 17 years old. They are the greatest gift that God has given her and above all are the reason she struggles each day to be able to offer them a decent life filled with love.

Day after day, Maria works in a medical center in the city because she is a nurse technician. She works about 12 hours a day and is able to pay household expenses from the fruit of her labor since she is a single mother. She believes that she is doing well at work because she is a responsible person and since very young she has always wanted to help people.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to pay for the educational expenses of her oldest daughter. Her daughter has been accepted at an institution in the city and Maria has to pay her tuition and registration fees. In this way she will be able to give her daughter a higher education and continue struggling to make her greatest dream a reality, that of helping both of her daughters become professionals so they will be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition and registration fees.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell for her fruits and vegetables business.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. Josephine earns more income from her general store.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Etibarhan

texts.ru: Этиборхон 39 года, имеет дочь 17 лет. Этиборхон имеет средне-специальное образование, после окончания училища и по сей день работает в доме инвалидов. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Этиборхон начала заниматься животноводством и садоводством. Начатое с 5,000 сом (KGS) 12 лет назад хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Этиборхон, ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 дойные коровы, 6 голов МРС. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Этиборхон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Этиборхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Etibarhan is 39 years old and she has a 17 year old daughter.  Etibarhan has a secondary-level specialized education, and from the time she graduated to today, she works in a home for the disabled.  As another source of income for her family, Etibarhan started a business in animal husbandry and market gardening.  The business she began 12 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS) today brings in about 7,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products.  As a result of her hard work, Etibarhan now has two milk cows and six head of sheep and goats.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Etibarhan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle.  Etibarhan plans to invest the profits from the loan in further growing her business by increasing the number of cattle that she has.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en: Theresie is 58 years old. She is married with seven children. The oldest is 38 years old and the youngest is 22. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in business for sixteen years. She wants a loan to buy milk, soda, bread and African-style donuts. The profit will go into her savings.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sodas and bread for sale.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

NWTF is presenting Felisa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 23 years old and a business man. He is single but supports his parents. He has been running a boutique for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a credit officer. 

Eliud will use the loan to buy new clothes in bales for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his siblings. His hopes are to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes in bales for resale

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

Juanita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Juanita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Enello Lucero

texts.es:
Enello es un hombre de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia con sus esposa y su pequeño hijo de un año, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Enello no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional,  pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pescar y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Enello trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de plátanos, él produce y comercializa dicha fruta, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como obrero en una planta de tratamiento de agua de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, Enello cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Enello se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del riego, compra de fertilizantes y mantenimiento de su cultivo, de esta manera Enello espera obtener una buena y realizar una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran productor de plátanos y otros cultivos.
texts.en:
Enello is a 25 year old man and lives in the city of Aguaytia with his wife and little one year old son. He loves them and they are his main focus in life. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who puts all of his effort into getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of resources and the need to work, Enello could not study for a professional career but he would have liked to have been able to. In his free time he likes to fish and occasionally cooks a delicious "pachamanca" to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with a lot of perseverance and dedication, Enello works in his small business selling plantains. He produces and sells this fruit and also works during the weekends as a worker in the water treatment plant for the city. He works every day from early in the morning for about 12 hours in a day. Enello believes that it is going well for him because of his determination and friendly manner that he provides to others. 

Enello is very thankful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided, he will be able to cover the expenses in irrigation, the purchase of fertilizers and the maintenance of his crop. In this way, Enello hopes to obtain a better yield and makes good sales. He will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve his great dream of becoming a great producer of plantains and other crops.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of irrigation, the purchase of fertilizers and crop maintenance.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en: Batmunkh, 27, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Ten months ago, he began to work as an engineer at construction business. His wife has a position of distribution manager at a private company. His two children go to kindergarten. The family resides in an apartment. As winter comes to Mongolia, it becomes difficult to go to work without his own automobile because they live in a quite remote place. Also, picking up his children from school and driving his wife to work become necessary as night comes earlier in the winter time. So, he is requesting a loan of 6800000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. As a result, he can drive his wife to work and sons to kindergarten. Most importantly, an automobile which runs on natural gas emits less smoke thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase a car which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
This is Rona, 32, a resident of Taguig, Manila. Her husband is Jasper, who works as a driver, and they have three children. They work together to manage their household and generate income for their everyday expenses.

Rona sells shih tzu dogs. Shih tzu are adorable dogs so they are very easy to sell. Her customers are her friends and relatives. Her neighbors and the locals in the community are also attracted to buy.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15 000 loan. She will use the loan to buy dog food and for the dogs’ grooming. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings would be a big help for the educational expenses of her children. 

Rona hopes to give her children a bright future and dreams of expanding her business. She wants a good life and good health for her family. She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only to God but also to her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship groupis composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build socialcapital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for food and grooming of her dogs for sale.

loans.name: Miguel Clemente

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres, él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Miguel no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional,  pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miguel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de cultivo de cebolla, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Miguel cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del riego, compra de fertilizantes y mantenimiento de su cultivo, de esta manera Miguel espera obtener una buena y realizar una buena venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 34 year old man who is single and lives in the city of Nazca with his parents. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Miguel was unable to study for a professional career. He would have liked to have done so. In his spare time he enjoys listening to music and occasionally cooks a delicious “arroz con pollo” to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with a great deal of effort and dedication, Miquel works at his business cultivating onions. In addition he works as a field laborer on an estate in the city on weekends. He works every day from very early in the morning and puts in approximately 8 hours. He feels things are going well for him because of his good performance and friendly treatment of others.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to cover  the costs of irrigating, fertilizing and maintaining his fields. Thus he will be able to continue working to achieve his great dream, which is to have his own house

loans.use: to cover the costs of irrigating, fertilizing and maintaining his fields

loans.name: Ruphus

texts.en:
Ruphus is 52 years old, married to Alfred and they have been blessed with six children, ages 28, 27, 22, 21,19 and 18. She does dairy and poultry farming and has been in business for 22 years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 60,000.

She is borrowing KES 100,000 to purchase more dairy cows and more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.She will reinvest the anticipated profit in the business.

This is her second loan and she successfully paid her previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Julieta has been raising pigs for 12 years and earns additional income from running a general store and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 28 years old and married with 3 children.
She earns a living by pig farming in the Philippines. Julita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Julita has been involved in pig farming for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying & selling vegetables.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jensen

texts.en:
Jensen is married and works hard to support her family.
She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jensen is borrowing PHP 28,000.00 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.
Jensen has been sustaining her business activities with help from her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy more fsh to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяна - предприниматель, торгует женской одеждой на рынке. Она использовала предыдущий КИВА кредит для закупки сезонного товара. В этот раз Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки нового ассортимента женских шапок. Недавно Татьяна поменяла свое торговое место на лучшее. Татьяна надеется, что благодаря новому месту, а также новому ассортименту товара она сможет увеличить объем продаж и заработать дополнительную прибыль, которую она хотела бы потратить на улучшение своих жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Tatyana is a trader selling women's clothing in the marketplace. She used a previous Kiva loan to buy seasonal goods. 

This time, Tatyana is asking for a loan for the purchase of women's hats. Tatyana recently changed her trading space for a better one. 

Tatyana hopes through the new location and a new assortment of products she will be able to increase sales and earn additional income, which she would like to spend on improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy women's hats

loans.name: Domitile

texts.en: Domitile is 33 years old. She is married with 4 children. Her oldest child is 14 and the youngest is 6. Her husband is a driver. She has been in the business of selling charcoal for 2 years. She wants a loan to buy more charcoal. She will use her profits to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Monica

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de muy alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella vive al lado de sus padres en la calurosa y amigable ciudad de Pucallpa, ubicada en la selva peruana y la cual se caracteriza por su flora y fauna muy hermosa. Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo con mucha fuerza de voluntad y ganas de salir adelante Rosa trabaja como secretaria en una universidad de su ciudad, ella lobora alrededor de 7 horas al dia ya que tambien estudia en dicha univeridad la carrera de contabilidad y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios; ella cree que le va bien proque e smuy responsable y sobre todo porque su deseo de superacion.

Rosa esta muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado por los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra realizar los pagos de matricula y tramites para el nuevo ciclo de estudios, de esta manera ella podra estar al dia en los pagos y no tener inconvenientes para cursar un nuevo ciclo, asi ella seguira luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Ser una gran profesional y sobre todo tener una casa propia".
texts.en:
Rosa is a cheerful youth with a strong desire to get ahead. She lives next to her parents in the warm and friendly city of Pucallpa, located in the Peruvian jungle, which is characterized by its beautiful flora and fauna. With a lot of effort, and above all a lot of will power and desire to get ahead, Rosa works as a secretary in a university in her city. She works around seven hours a day, since she is also pursuing a degree in accounting at that university. With the fruits of her labor, she can cover the expenses for her studies. She believes that things are going well for her because she is very responsible and above all due to her desire to overcome.

Rosa is very grateful for the support provided by the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they have provided her, she will be able to make the payments for her tuition and payments for the new course cycle. In this way, she will be up-to-date on her payments and will not experience any problems in studying another cycle. Like that, she will continue fighting to be able to make her biggest dream “to be a great professional and above all to have her own home” a reality.

loans.use: to pay tuition and administrative fees for university.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 3 children, ages ranging from 20 to 30 years. She describes herself as a self-motivated woman. She is involved in livestock farming where she sells livestock and milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 3 staff. Her business is located in semi-arid area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from her customers. She will use the KES 11,100 loan to purchase a water tank which will be used by her five family members for household chores. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a dairy farm. This is her eighth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza is 56 years old. She lives in the Mtskheta District with her husband. Roza has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for her family business start-up without any success. Her loan requests have been rejected many times because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the monthly salaries of Roza and her husband, who works at a restaurant. Roza is requesting a loan from Credo to start-up her family business. She will use her loan to build a shed and purchase pigs to start an animal husbandry business. She will put the pigs in a shed in the yard and raise and sell them for a higher price. Roza's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country’s rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Roza's new business initiative, financed with her Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to build a shed and purchase pigs.

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es:
Grecia, de 20 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser alegre y muy amable. Es soltera sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de su madre, sus 03 hermanos y su abuela, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre.
La actividad que realiza Grecia a es la costura oficio que aprendió estudiando de muy joven en un centro de educación ocupacional ya que le llamo la atención viendo a su madre quien también se dedica a esta labor, luego compro su primera máquina de coser empezando con su oficio y con las ganancias del trabajo que realiza se compró otras máquinas. 
Lleva realizando esta actividad en la casa de su madre y está  instalada en un ambiente formando una sociedad con su madre.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por los pedidos constante de trabajo que tiene y las ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su oficio pues le permite tener una ocupación y generar un ingreso para ahorrar y en ocasiones apoyar a su familia con los gastos de hogar.  Viendo la rotación constante que tiene su capital invertido ve crecer su negocio.  Por eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprar más máquinas y abrir una tienda de venta de ropas donde pueda exhibir sus trabajos. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03  con la institución MFP. Por ello desea un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles,  lo invertirá en su totalidad en la  compra de telas, botones, cierres, elástico y demás accesorios de costura. Todos traídos desde la capital, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras, para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Grecia, 20, is a hardworking, happy, and very friendly young woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  She's single and has no children.  She lives comfortably in her mother's house with her mother, her three siblings, and her grandmother.

Grecia's job is sewing, a trade she learned at a young age studying in an occupational education center because she had watched her mother, who also makes a living doing this work.  Then she bought her first sewing machine and began with her job, and with her profits she bought herself other machines.  She does this work in her mother's house, set up in an environment in association with her mother.  She considers her business very profitable because of her constant job requests and the earnings from them.

She likes her work because it allows her to have an occupation and generate an income to save, and sometimes help her family with the household expenses.  And seeing the constant turnover of her invested capital, she sees her business grow.  This is why she plans to expand her business, buy more machines, and open a store to show her work.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She wants a small loan to be able to achieve her objectives.  She's committed to making her payments on time.  Also, she likes being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

She'll invest the entire requested amount, 1200 nuevos soles [PEN], in buying fabric, buttons, zippers, elastic, and other sewing accessories bought in the capital at low prices for buying in volume.  This way she'll get a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, elastic, and other accessories

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно 53 года. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. У Барно трудная судьба, так как ее муж умер молодым, и она осталась с 1 ребенком одна. Все свою жизнь она упорно трудилась, чтобы ее ребенок не остался без еды и без образования. Она проработала более 30 лет в детском саду. Она очень любимая няня в детском саду и ее коллеги уважают ее. Барно еще умелая женщина, она умеет шить национальный матрас «курпача». С целью получения дополнительного дохода, она решила организовать свой бизнес шитьем и продажи «курпача». С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От этого курса она получила много информаций. Она теперь уверена в реализации своего плана. Она будет продавать свой товар на местном рынке, и ее мать будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000  сомони для покупки ткани для шитья «курпача», чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Barno is 53 years old. She is a very kind and hardworking woman. Barno has a difficult life since her husband died young and she was left alone with a young child. All her life, she worked hard so that her child was not left without food or education. 

She worked for more than 30 years in a kindergarten. She is a much-loved nurse in the kindergarten and all her colleagues respected her. 

Barno is still a skillful woman and she knows how to sew national mattresses called "kurpacha". In order to generate additional income, she decided to start a business sewing and selling "kurpacha". To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She got a lot of information from this course. She is now confident in her plan. She will be selling her goods in the local market, and her mother will help her in doing business. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fabric for sewing "kurpacha" in order to establish a new business. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón tiene veinte años viviendo en esta localidad, y desde que llegó aquí ha luchado por obtener su casa. El motivo de su primer crédito fue para la adquisición de su vivienda y ahora que ya la tiene quiere invertir en ella, ya serán dos créditos obtenidos en nuestra institución, desea que el día de mañana sea el patrimonio de sus hijos, los cuales no viven con él sino con su esposa que tiene varios años de estar separado de ella.
Tiene la ilusión de bardear su casa ya que hoy en día hay mucha inseguridad, él vive solo y es más su temor de que un día le lleguen a robar las cosas que él ha obtenido con el esfuerzo de todos estos años.
texts.en: Ramón has been in this locality for 20 years, and ever since he arrived, he has fought to obtain his house. His first loan was to acquire his home and now, since he has it, he wants to invest in it. This will make two loans that he has obtained from our institution. His desire is that someday it will be his children’s inheritance. His children do not live with him, but rather with his wife, from whom he has been separated for several years. He has the idea of building an enclosing wall around his house, since there is a lot of insecurity today. He lives alone, and his biggest fear is that one day someone robs him of all the things that he has acquired with the effort of all these years.

loans.use: to buy materials and hire labor to construct an enclosing wall around his house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia; she previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more fruits. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and other products for her variety store. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial advantage with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Virginia hopes to have a good life and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional fruits and other products needed for her variety store.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 42-year-old business man, and married to Winnie who is a business woman. They are blessed with four children. He has been running a grocery business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. James will use the loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell.
With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build rental houses and improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy stock of  vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like spices, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc. for her general store.
Lita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.
Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like spices, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: За последние годы условие проживания Инобата и ее семьи существенно изменилась в худшую сторону. Инобат более 15 лет занималась скотоводством вместе с мужем, но год за годом ее 2 детей требуют все больше благ. Их доход скотоводство больше не удовлетворяет семейный бюджет. Уже несколько месяцев Инобат собирается реализовать свой план об организации нового бизнеса шитьем женской одежды. Она умелая портниха и шьёт красивые женские одежды. Наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и обучилась в этом курсе и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и ткани, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Over the last few years, the living conditions of Inobat and her family have changed for the worse. For more than 15 years, Inobat engaged in raising livestock with her husband, but year after year her two children require more benefits. Their income from livestock no longer meets the family budget. 

For several months already, Inobat has been planning to establish her own business sewing women's clothing. She is a skillful dressmaker and sews beautiful women's clothing. Finally, she learned of a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and took this course and received a certificate. 

Now, she can fully start a business and become successful in this field. From the revenue, she plans to provide her children with a good education and high-calorie food. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabric to establish a new business. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 53 years old and from Kaspi district. He lives with his wife and son. Merab has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting up a family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is monthly income earned by his son, working as distributor. He makes 300 Laris total per month. It is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Merab requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received loan, Merab will purchase plumbing equipment. After purchasing the equipment, he will be able to work as a plumber, will get orders and thus increase monthly income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing equipment

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза мотивированная и энергичная женщина. Она всегда старается реализовать свои планы и получать выгоду. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж не обеспечивает семью и поэтому, Фируза является основной кормилицей в семье. Более 15 лет она занимается выращиванием зерновых культур, а также виноградарством. Так как последнее время она не получает намеченный урожай, так и не может заработать достаточно денег для проживания и поэтому трудное условие жизни заставляет ее работать все больше и больше. Единственным выходом для получения дополнительного дохода и улучшения условия проживания  это создать новый бизнес, считает Фируза. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как она живет в сельской местности и имеет хорошие условия для животноводства. От полученного дохода она планирует купить все не обходимые средства для проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Firuza is a motivated and energetic woman. She always tries to realize her plans and to receive their benefits. She is married and is raising two young children. Her husband does not provide for the family and therefore Firuza is the main breadwinner in the family. For more than 15 years, she has been engaged in growing crops and vegetables, and viticulture. The last time she did not get the intended crop and could not earn enough money to live, and therefore difficult living conditions force her to work more and more. 

The only way to generate additional income and to improve living conditions is to create a new business, says Firuza. To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. 

Now, she can fully organize a business and become successful in this area. She wants to organize a business buying and selling livestock, since she lives in a rural area and has good conditions for livestock. From the revenue, she plans to buy all the needed means for living. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy cattle to establish a new business. She is awaiting your kindess.

loans.use: to organize a new cattle business

loans.name: Vany Manuel

texts.es: Vany Manuel, 41 años de edad acompañado con 6 hijos, todos menores de edad que comprenden de 17,15,13 (6to grado),12(6to grado),10(1er grado) y 15meses, es una persona muy trabajadora, desde muy temprano se pone en pie para comenzar su jornada diaria de trabajo él se dedica a la comercialización de Mariscos como: Pescado, camarones, punches y otros mariscos. Vany está muy agradecido con la ayuda de los inversionistas del fondo Kiva que les ha brindado el apoyo a las personas de muy bajos recursos para tener un trabajo digno y así poder prosperar él solicita financiamiento para invertir en la compra de variedades de  mariscos porque tiene varios encargos que en esta fecha la demanda crece mayormente y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Vany Manuel, 41, has six children, all minors, ages 17,15,13 (6th grade), 12 (6th grade), 10 (1st grade) and 15 months. He is a very hard worker; he gets up very early every day to begin his day's work.  He sells seafood such as fish, shrimp, and other seafood. Vany is very grateful for the help of Kiva fund investors who have given support to people with very low incomes, enabling them to get a decent job and prosper. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of various types of seafood because he has several orders with growing demand, and to meet customer orders.

loans.use: to buy fish and take advantage of the demand for buying fish.

loans.name: Munazendy

texts.en:
Munazendy is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of a three-year-old son from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Munazendy is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks, buckets and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish thus giving them more to sell in the market. Munazendy dreams of making their business a successful one. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks, buckets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 34 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is 5 years old. Her husband is a driver. She has been selling food stuff for the past 13 years. She wants a loan to buy more bananas and potatoes. The profit will pay for the children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her dress making business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maribel dreams of giving her children a quality education. She hopes to expand her business and have a good life. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Marilyn has been pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from buying & selling rice grains.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 54-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 18 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be honest and committed to her work. She operates a livestock farming business where she sells milk, livestock and skin. She has been involved in this business for 16 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers as she has limited access to the market. She will use the KES 8,700 loan to purchase a water tank, which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Mannareli Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly es una joven muy carismatica y sobre todo luchadora. su vivienda se  ubica en la ciuadad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor, asimismo las personas que habitan esta ciudad son personas muy alegres y sobre todo carismaticas. Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo muchas ganas Magaly ha estudiado la carrera de Enfermeria y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos no tienen muchos ingresos economicos; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque tiene la vocacion de ayudar a los demas.

Magaly esta agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra realziar los tramites y poder obtener su titulo profesional como enfermera,de esta manera ella podra mejorar sus ingresos y poder conseguir un mejor trabajo y asi seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Magaly is a very charismatic and above all tenacious young woman. Her home is located in the city of Pucallpa, which is characterized by having a very warm and inviting climate. Also, the people who live in this city are very happy and especially charismatic people. With much effort and above all much enthusiasm Magaly has studied nursing and with the fruit of her labor supported her parents with household expenses since they don’t have much income. She believes that she does well in her work because she is very friendly and especially because she is drawn to helping others.

Magaly is thankful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have provided her she will be able to complete the formalities and be able to obtain her professional nursing degree. This way, she will be able to improve her income and be able to find a better job and therefore continue fighting to be able to make her greatest dream a reality: “To have her own home.”

loans.use: to complete the formalities of a professional degree.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de  Nazca con su esposa y sus dos pequeñas hijas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente Carlos tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, por tal motivo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para engreírlo, ya que esta es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja todos los días como chofer en una ferretería de su ciudad, él transporta los materiales de construcción en un camión a diversas partes, Carlos puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y buen desempeño.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos médicos, transporte y hospitalización de su Suegra, ya que ella se encuentra muy delicada de salud y requiere ser trasladada a un centro médico de la capital del país para poder tratar su penosa enfermar, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, para así poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 37 years old,  he lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and two young daughters, whom he loves and are his main reason for living. He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all his efforts to raise his family. Unfortunately, Carlos had to start working at an early age to help his parents, and was unable to pursue a career, but he would have liked very much to do so. In his spare time, he likes to listen to music and sometimes his wife cooks a delicious arroz con pollo to pamper him, as this is his favorite food.

Of his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Carlos works every day as a driver for a hardware store in their city. He transports building materials on a truck to different areas. Carlos can work for about 12 hours; he feels comfortable doing the work and believes that he does well because of his responsibility and good performance.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their assistance, may cover medical expenses, transportation and hospitalization of his mother, as she is in very delicate health and needs to be taken to a medical center in the capital to treat her painful illness. Carlos will continue to work and strive to achieve his dream of completing the construction of their home, in order to provide greater security and wellness for himself and his family.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses, transportation and hospitalization.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 51 years old and married with two children. She has been raising rabbits and poultry for the past year with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Alice will use the loan to buy more rabbits, chicks and feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to keep rabbits and chicks in a large-scale operation and to introduce chicken raising into her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more rabbits and animal feed.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is married and works hard to support her family. She earns a living by making and selling abaca in the Philippines.

Genara requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for abaca weaving.

loans.name: Bolortuya

texts.en: Mrs. Bolortuya, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She works as a decorator at a private company. Her husband earns income by using his truck to transport goods. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. The house they live in needs some home appliances. Also, the truck her husband uses has deteriorated over the years and needs some repair. As winter comes to Mongolia, the house gets cold and the family is in need of some heating source. So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase an LCD television, carpet, coal and some equipment for truck repair. As a result, the family can improve their living environment, as well as repair their income-generating truck.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances and coal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather and thread for a bag making business

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia is 31 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi District with her husband, Mikheil, and two children (10 and 5 years old). Natia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family grows watermelons and haricots on the family-owned land and the harvested products are sold at the local open market. Besides, Natia is a baker and sells rolls at the local school canteen.  Natia requested a loan from Credo to start livestock farming. Her loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Natia will purchase calves and feed for them. She will raise them and sell them after several months. Grown calves will be sold for a good price, bringing additional income to the family. For the next cycle, Natia will purchase more calves. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and feed for them

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and she earns additional income from farming rice.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy & sell charcoal business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to fsend her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial alñ lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchisimo y a los cuales apoya muchos con el fruto de su trabajo. en su tiempo libre a blanca le gusta leer pero sobtre todo le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus paltillos favoritos el cual es la riquisima sopa seca cañetana. 
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion Blanca se encuentar estudiando en un instituto de su ciudad, y es por ello que ella trabaja como empleada en una tienda de su ciudad para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clentes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Blanca esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva podra comprar materiales de contruccion como cemento, arena, entre otros para poder terminar de contruir la fachada de su vivienda que es de adobe y poder realizar elñ tarrajeo de la misma, asi ella podra mjeorar la calidad de vida de sus padres y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Terminar su carrera y poder apoyar a su familia".
texts.en:
Blanca is a 19 year old young woman. She lives in the city of Imperial, along with her parents whom she loves very much and whom she supports with the income from her work. In her free time she likes to read, but above all she likes to enjoy one of her favorite traditional dishes 'sopa seca cañetana' (a pasta dish with chicken and a tomato based sauce).

With much effort and dedication, Blanca is currently studying in an academic institute in the city. This is why she works as an employee in a store that is located in her city, so that she can cover the costs of her studies. She believes she does well in her job because she is very friendly with the customers and above all because she has a strong desire to get ahead and make her parents proud.   

Blanca is very thankful for the support that is being given to her by Kiva lenders, so that she can buy construction materials like cement, sand, etc. She will use the supplies to finish building the front of her house, which is made of adobe, as well as plaster the walls. In this way Blanca will be able to improve the quality of life of her parents and continue working to accomplish her biggest dream, to finish studying and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Siempre Juntas Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el  grupo Siempre Juntas

Este grupo está emprendiendo el quinto ciclo, son 05 socias que se conocen entre sí. Marina es la presidenta del grupo ella  tiene 58 años, es casada con 03 hijos mayores de edad. Marina se dedica a vender productos de belleza, ya lleva vendiendo cerca de 02 años y le va muy bien, sus clientes lo conforman sus amigas familiares y algunas personas que ella encuentra por su propia cuenta, por ahora no cuenta con un lugar donde vender directamente;  pero más adelante desea abrir un negocio dedicado a la belleza, el dinero de su préstamo lo utilizara para mejorar su negocio con la compra de diversos productos como perfumes, colonias y maquillaje. Con el abastecimiento de estos productos podrá atender a su clientela así su negocio ira prosperando.
Marina está muy agradecida por el préstamo para su grupo comunal, especialmente a EDAPROSPO y a los Inversionistas KIVA de todo el mundo.
Marina aparece en la foto de pie con blusa negra y verde.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This is the group Siempre Juntas. This group of five members who know each other is undertaking their fifth loan. Marina is the president of the group, she is 58, married, and has 3 adult children. 

Marina has been selling beauty products for about 2 years and is doing very well. Her customers are made up of family friends and some people that she found on her own. For now does not have a place to sell directly, but later she wants to open a business dedicated to beauty. The money from this loan will be used to improve her business with the purchase of various products such as perfumes, colognes and makeup. With the supply of these products she can cater to her clientele and in this way, her business will thrive.

Marina is grateful for the loan to her communal bank, especially to EDAPROSPO and Kiva investors worldwide. 

Marina is pictured standing in the photo dressed in a black and green blouse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 38 years old. He is married with three children, the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 8 years old. His wife is also a businesswoman. H has been in business for seven years. He wants a loan to buy more flowers. With the profits from the business, he will finish his house.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en: Marguerite is 39 years old. She is married with no children. She has been in business for three years. She sells art crafts such as peace baskets. With the loan, she will buy more art crafts. She will save her profits.

loans.use: To buy more peace baskets for resale.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old and married with four children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is 32 years of age and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rodelia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rodelia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Rodelia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, wire, rebar, and animal feed

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 44-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are both schooling. He has been in farming for the past 12 years producing milk and fruit, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will sell the products and get extra income to help him uplift his living standards and use some of the money to pay for his children's education. He plans to buy his own car for transporting his products in the next five years.

Lack of readily available market for his products and drought are his major challenges in farming.

James says Juhudi Kilimo is the best Microfinance institution.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Wilfredo Enrique

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, ha tenido muchas dificultades pero ello no ha hecho que deje de luchar por mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo poder demostrar cuanto vale. El vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima calido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodon, uva, entre otros. Debido a sus pocos recursos economicos el solo pudo estudiar el nivel primario, pero le hubeira gustado estudiar la carrera de educacion.

Dia a dia Wilfredo trabaja como estibador, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar; el  cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrado.

Wilfredo esta muy agardecido con los prestatarios Kiva yaq eu gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podra comprar una refrigeradora para sus padres ya que ellos cocinan actualmente a base a leña y con esta mejora evitar el tener accidentes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, asi el podra seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener un negocio propio y estudiar".
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a hard-working and enthusiastic man.  He has had many difficulties, but they have not stopped him from striving for a better quality of life, and above all, demonstrating his worth.  

He lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its warm and inviting climate.  He also works in agriculture, specifically farming cotton and grapes, among others.  Due to scarce economic resources, he was only able to study in primary school, though he would have liked to get a degree in education.  

Day-to-day, Wilfredo works as a longshoreman, working around 8 hours a day.  With the fruits of his labor, he helps his parents with household expenses.  He believes his work is going well because he is very responsible and above all, honest.  

Wilfredo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support, he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his parents.  They currently cook over a wood fire, and this improvement will avoid accidents and improve his family's quality of life.  It will also allow him to continue pursuing his greatest dream:  "to have his own business and to study."

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El Sr. Jesús es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, siempre viendo por el bienestar de su esposa y su único hijo, trabaja en la recolección de aceite de cocina quemado desde hace veinte años en varios restaurantes y lo vende a empresas de Monterrey cada mes.
Con su segundo crédito recibido de nuestra institución abrirá su negocio de comida, es por eso que quiere comprar mercancía para aperturarlo con mucha variedad en las comidas, el crédito pasado lo utilizó para la construcción del cuarto donde pondría el negocio, y ahora pide nuestro apoyo nuevamente para terminar detalles faltantes y para aperturarlo, así empezaría el negocio familiar en donde participaría su esposa junto con él.
La idea del Sr. Jesús es de que por las mañanas lo atienda su esposa mientras él trabaja en la recolección del aceite y ya por las tardes lo atenderían juntos, poder aumentar los ingresos familiares para que a su hijo no le falte nada respecto a su educación.
texts.en:
Jesús is a very hard working and responsible person. He is always looking out for the well-being of his wife and his only son. He has worked collecting burned cooking oil for the past twenty years, collecting it from various restaurants and selling it to other businesses in Monterrey on a monthly basis.  

With this loan, which is the second loan that he will receive through the communal bank, he will open a food stall. He wants to buy merchandise so that when he opens his business he will have a wide variety of items to offer. The previous loan he received, he used to build a room where the food stall will be located. Now he is requesting our help again in order to finish a few details so that he can open. This will allow him to start his family business, where he and his wife will work together. His idea is that his wife will work in the mornings, while he is collecting cooking oil and in the afternoons they will work together. As a result they will be able to increase the income of their family and their son will never lack resources to support his education.

loans.use: to finish necessary details to be able to open his food stall and to buy merchandise for the opening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 33 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest child is 4 years old and the youngest is 10 months.  Her husband is a businessman. 

She has been in the retail business for ten years. She wants the loan to add more items such as cooking oil and rice to her retail store. The profits from the business will go into her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Mayra de 19 años es estudiante de Traducción e Interpretación 
Mayra siempre se intereso por esta profesión debido a su interés por los idiomas y las diferentes culturas. Su carrera tiene como duración 5 años de los cuales ya lleva 2 años estudiando en una universidad local, a Mayra le va muy bien en sus estudios. Ella es muy dedicada porque quiere ser una buena interprete, diariamente se dedica aproximadamente 7 horas a los estudios.
