En el futuro le gustaría hablar 8 idiomas y viajar para perfeccionarse, su préstamo le servirá para pagar las mensualidades de un ciclo en la universidad, por otro lado considera muy importante la ayuda que recibe, ya que gracias a sus préstamos podrá continuar estudiando; muchas veces no contar con los medios económicos es un obstáculo para los jóvenes como ella.
A Mayra le gustaría agradecer a los Inversionistas de KIVA por apoyarla en su objetivo de convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Mayra, 19 years old, is a student of Translation and Interpretation.
Mayra was always interested in this profession due to her interest in languages and different cultures. Her studies have a 5-year duration of which she already has 2 years studying in a local university. Mayra is doing very well in her studies. She is very dedicated because she wants to be a good interpreter. She studies approximately 7 hours daily. In the future, she would like to speak 8 languages and travel in order to improve them. Her loan will help her to pay the monthy fees for a university semester. On the other hand, she considers the help that she receives very important, since thanks to her loans she will be able to continue studying; many times, not having the economic means is an obstacle for young people like her.
Marya would like to thank the investors of KIVA for supporting her in her goal of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay the monthly fees for a university semester

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing/fish vending business.

Marylou has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from a general store.

Marylou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, 32, lives in Nkubu county in Kenya with her husband and two children, both of whom are in school. She has been farming for the past eight years, growing bananas, potatoes, tea and cabbages, all of which she sells at the local market. Theft and inadequate funds are her major business challenges.

Serah is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water tanks for irrigation, This will help increase her agricultural production, resulting in more income that will assist her in improving the family's living conditions and paying for her children's schooling. Serah aspires to open a cereal shop within the next five years.

Serah believes Juhudi Kilimo offers the best services for its clients.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks.

loans.name: Criz Rosario

texts.es:
Criz es una mujer de 28 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Criz pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Pachamanca, ya que esta es su comida favorita.  
 Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Criz trabaja como profesora de educación inicial en un centro escolar de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y lo hace por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Criz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios para una especialización en educación, de esta manera Criz desea culminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y así poder tener mayor posibilidades de asenso y mejora profesional, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logara su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda y con ello brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Criz is 28, single, and lives in the city of Chincha with her ​​parents. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire to excel. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, was able to pursue a degree in education. In her spare time, she likes to share great moments with her family and on some of these occasions, she makes a delicious pachamanca, as this is her favorite food.

Of her own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Criz works as preschool teacher in a school in her city. She works every day from early in the morning for about 8 hours. She feels good doing her work and believes that she does well because of her good performance and her friendly attitude towards others.

Criz is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help she has received, she can cover the cost of studies for a major in education. Criz wants to successfully complete her studies so she can have greater chances of professional advancement and betterment. She will continue to work and strive for her dream to finish building her home and thereby provide greater security and well-being for his family.

loans.use: to cover expenses for her major.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a 43-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children. She has been running a beauty salon for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Jedidah is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. She will use the loan to buy beauty products, a hair dryer and braids. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Jedidah will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, a hair dryer and braids.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 32 years old. She is married with two children who are two years old. Her husband is a civil servant. She has been in business for six years. She wants this loan to buy more clothes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 29 years old, married, and has two children who are currently in school.  She has been a merchant for two years. She decided to create her own form of income, owing to the economic situation of our country. She states that she began with her own capital, which thankfully has increased. She possesses a local store situated in her home. She is open seven days a week because her customers demand it, and she offers everyday products.

Presently, Fatuma wants to increase her business, for which she is applying for a loan from Yehu, with which she can buy the following products: rice, sugar, oil, beans, eggs, flour, milk, soap, deodorant, etc.

Fatuma says that this loan will allow her to grow and offer more products to her customers, which is important to her because in this way she will maintain the satisfaction of her customers in that they will always be able to find their desired product.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of a 21-year-old daughter from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a farmer.

Nida is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks like sardines, noodles, rice, chips and snack foods, and other items. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers and buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and profit.

In the future, Nida hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the capital city of Georgia. Maia’s husband works as an elevator technician and gets a monthly salary. Maia’s economic activity is a newly started business. In particular, a small store where tobaccos, beverages and different kinds of snacks are sold.  Maia requested loan from local financial institutions for the business expansion, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected, because of low income and insufficient experience in her business.

Maia was involved in the same type of business during three years and worked as a saleslady, but the owner decided to stop the business because of financial problems. Maia started her own business, as the project was profitable. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's  rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Maia will enlarge and develop her store. She will purchase stocks at wholesale prices and sell for a higher profit.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly increase her monthly income and Maia will reinvest the received profit in the same business. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: purchase stocks for her store

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah  is a 34-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 6 years old. She describes herself to be self-driven at work and hard-working . She runs a restaurant where she sells drinks and food. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a busy market and the customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to expand her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.  Her business goal is to have multiple restaurant outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Neneth has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from a general store. 

Neneth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 33 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is 5. She has been in business for 5 years and wants a loan to buy more foodstuff to resell.   Her husband is a policeman. With the profit she will put it into her savings.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, a 34-year-old married mother of four, lives in Msambweni, a town in the coastal region of Kenya. With her cousin as the driver, Fatuma provides motorcycle services, a business she has had for four years. She has requested a loan of Ksh 30,000 to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

In the future, Fatuma hopes to improve her services and buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 44-year-old business lady.  She is married to Nixon, a business man. They currently have no children but live with her niece.  

Susan has been running a beauty salon for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.  She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a credit officer. Susan will use the loan to buy beauty products, a hair dryer and braids. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Susan will educate the child. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, hair dryer and braids

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 31-year-old married man.  He has 2 children with ages 2 and 5 years. He describes himself to be a go-getter man and hard-working. He operates a grocery store  where he sells vegetables and fruits. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of vegetables and fruits to sell. His business goal is to own a large grocery store  within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en:
Nemie is 46 years old and married with 4 children.  Nemie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like coffee, sugar, can goods, soap, etc.

Nemie has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nemie aspires to save enough money so she can  afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora, a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for two years now, also earns income from a general store. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Digna Erlinda

texts.es:
Digna es una mujer de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Digna pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta criar aves y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Olluquito con Charqui para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Digna trabaja en su pequeño negocio  de venta de rocoto, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Digna se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, arena y otros, de esta manera Digna podrá hacer los acabados de su vivienda, tales como tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de instalaciones, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Digna is 43 and lives in the city of Nazca with her ​​husband and two young children whom she loves and are her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who along with her husband, devotes all her efforts to raising their family. Thanks to her efforts and the support of their parents, Digna was able to pursue a degree in education. In her spare time, she likes to breed birds and sometimes she cooks a delicious charqui olluquito to share with her family.

Of her own volition, with much effort and enthusiasm, Digna works in her small business selling rocoto (a type of chili). She works every day from early in the morning for about 8 hours. She feels comfortable doing the work and believes that she does well because of her good prices and the friendly service she provides to her customers.

Digna is grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help she has received, may make the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand and others, so Digna can finish her home, such as plastering, painting and placing installations, so she will continue to work and strive to achieve her dream of providing greater security and well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
This is Efren, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Annaliza, a storekeeper, and he is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Efren maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one unit of tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning and works until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evenings until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting PHP 16,000 in his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Efren hopes to have a good life and dreams of expanding his business. He faithfully meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 42 years old and married with three children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Leonida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
This is Feliza. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Feliza hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old and has seven children. Norma is married and two of her children are in school.

Norma is in the agricultural business, farming coconuts and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her coconut farm.

Norma has been farming coconuts and selling dried coconut meat for nine years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her coconut farm.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Mr. Gantumur, 27 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a media person in a private company. He rents counter in a superstore and has been running his business for four years. His business includes selling goods such as books, pencils, picture frames and computer components and he also repairs damaged photos.  

Now his wife is pregnant and is on maternity leave. So he is in urgent need of an automobile because a pregnant person needs comfort and care. So he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which is powered by an electric motor. This kind of electric car emits less smoke and produces harmless pollution through the tailpipe from the on-board source of power, such as particulates, volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. As a result he can carry his wife to her destination safely and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is 47 years old. She is married and has four children who are adults. Her husband is farmer. She always helps her husband to grow grapes. 

Malohat always wanted to provide her children with a good education, but her husband’s income was not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life. That’s why she decided to start a new business with animal husbandry and provide her grandchildren with a good education and her children with a good living condition. 

She studied the course of “To get ahead” at a women’s organization and got enough skills about business. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman, as she is hardworking and smart. 

Malohat is asking for a loan of 600 somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice-farming business for several years together with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Norberta is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to produce a good harvest thus increasing their yield and income.

In the future, Norberta dreams of expanding their farming business and is saving money for to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Rati

texts.en:
Rati is 31 years old. He lives in Zestaponi District with his wife and three children. Rati requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig and piglets. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Rati requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Rati will purchase piglets and begin trading. He will expand his livestock and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start an animal-sales business.

loans.name: Ma.marivit

texts.en:
Ma. Marivit is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 49,000 loan through NWTF to purchase snack foods, soap, soft-drinks and beverages.

Ma. Marivit has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Marivit aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, soap, soft-drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 39-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She describes herself as humble and gentle. 

Christine operates a retail shop and a grocery store where she sells vegetables and household items.  She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a market, and her customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenges to be insecurity and frequent power blackouts within the area.

 Christine will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase household items and vegetables for resale. 

Her business goal is to run a bigger retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy household items and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 31 years old, married, and lives in Khashuri district with his retired mother, wife and an infant son. Levan is involved in his newly-started business of importing cars. The cars are sent from Germany and Levan sells them in Georgia for a profit. Several months ago, Levan decided to expand his business to supplement his income, but his loan requests have been rejected several times by local financial institutions. He lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify for a traditional loan under income requirements. 

Levan is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and restart-up loans with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers." Levan will use his loan to go to Germany himself and purchase two cars to resell for a profit. He hopes that his business will be profitable. By increasing his monthly income, he hopes that the new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cars for resale.

loans.name: Merie Joy

texts.en: Merie Joy is from Labayo, Tangub City. She's 32 years old, married and has one child. She manages a transport vehicle business as a source of income. Merie Joy has been engaged in the transportation business for five years and earned PHP 5,000 a month from her business. In 2011, Merie Joy joined GDMPC. Merie Joy asked for a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories to improve the business. She plans to use the generated income from the business to expand and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories to improve the business

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a 26-year-old married man. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a farm where he sells vegetables. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a productive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal crops, which he harvests and sells when they mature. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create job opportunities for people on his farm. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad (cycle rickshaw) transport business in the Philippines.

Nimfa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Nimfa would like to build and expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya is 50 years old. She is married and has two children who are adults. Her husband is a teacher in a school and has a small salary. She works on the farm but her income is not enough to improve her living conditions. 

With the objective of getting additional income she wants to organize her own business, animal husbandry. She studied on the course ‘To get ahead’ given by a women's organization and got more business skills. Her son and his wife will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as cattle are under high demand in the local market. 

She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle to set up the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to organize a new business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Luz is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy tools and nail polish.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and nail polish.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 60 years old. She is a widow with six children. Her oldest is 36 years old and the youngest is 20 years old. She is a restaurant owner and she has been in business for three years. With the profit she will provide food for the family.

loans.use: To add more foodstuffs for sale in the restaurant.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador y un esposo y padre amoroso, junto a su esposa hacen lo imposible por mantener a su familia y sobre todo porque sacan adelnate a sus 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, ya que para ellos sus hijos son el regalo mas grande que dios les ha podido dar y sobre todo porque son su razon de vivir. Debido  a los pocos recursos economicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educacion secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar para ser profesor de lenguaje.

dia a dia Miguel trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada, especialmente de la maquina de planchado de pistas, el labora alrededor de 12 horas al dia ya que siempre hay mucho trabajo y sobre todo que requiere de mucho cuidado; elñ cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es uy resposanble y cuidadoso con lo que hace.

Miguel esta muy agradecido con el apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra construir unos pequeños cuartos para sus hijos ya que debido a los constantes movivmientos teluricos las paredes estan muy requebrajadas y sobre todo que es muy peligroso para su hijos, de esta manera podra brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y podra seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" DArle una profesion a sus hijos y terminar de construir de material noble su vivienda".
texts.en:
Miguel is a very hardworking man, and a loving husband and father. Together with his wife they do the impossible by maintaining their family and overall moving forward with their two children who are ages 7 and 2. For them their children are the greatest gift that god could give and especially because they are his reason for living. Due to limited financial resources he was only able to obtain a 5th grade level of education, but he would have loved to study to be a language professor.

Day to Day Miguel works as an operator of heavy machinery, especially ironing machine tracks. He works around 12 hours a day as there is always much work and overall requires much caution. He believes that his work is going well because he is very responsible and careful at what he does.

Miguel is very grateful for the assistance of the Kiva loans since that to the help that has been provided he will be able to construct some small rooms for his children so due to constant earthquake movements, the walls are very unstable and above all it us very dangerous for the children. In this way he will be able to provide a better quality of life and will be able to continue struggling to be able to realize his great dream: "to give a profession to his children and finish the building his house with good materials."

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 32 years old. She is married with one child who is two years and 10 month old. Her husband works in a construction company. She has been in business for 8 years. 

She wants loan to buy more flowers. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings and provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Fridaus

texts.en:
Fridaus’ occupation is as a seamstress. She has had her own sewing workshop for some time, while at the same time still operating her vegetable stall. She learned from her mother when she was still very little; her mother taught her how to make articles of clothing like blouses, skirts and dresses among others but she had not yet got the opportunity to open a workshop.

She is thankful for the previous loan that helped her to increase her income and allowed her to open her new line of business: sewing.

Fridaus currently needs to fill some orders and needs raw materials to make cotton dresses for little girls and skirts for women. This is why she came by the office to request a loan to be able to meet demand. It’s worth mentioning that her dream is to have a better standard of living for her family and to gradually improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials to make dresses.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Judy, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for the past thirteen years, with a monthly income of KES 19,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. David will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into the zero grazing farming business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is 35 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest is 4. Her husband is a builder. 

Fausta has been in business for four years and wants the loan to buy more shoes. With the profit, she will feed her family.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar is very sociable and hard-working woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband and son are farmers. During some years she has been busy with animal husbandry but her income from her business is small and that’s why she decided to start a new business processing and selling nuts in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied on the course ‘To get ahead’ set up by a women's organization and got enough business skills business. Her son and husband will help her with the business. She will sell nuts at the local market. She will develop her business as nuts are in great demand. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy nuts to set up the new business. This loan will help her organize new business and in this way to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy nuts to set up a new business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42 year old married man. He has five children whose ages range from 10 years to 25 years. He describes himself as a hard working man. He operates a farm where he sells maize, tomatoes, beans etc. He has been involved in this business for 13 years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by his family members. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, de 62 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo. Está casado con Sarela de 60 años con quien comparte su casa propia la cual construyó sobre  el terreno que compró con la ayuda de su esposa.  Es padre de una hija quien ya es mayor e independiente a quien crió y educo. Actualmente vive en compañía de su esposa, su hija con su pareja más un nieto, con quienes comparte los gastos de la casa. La actividad que realiza José  es la venta de bebidas gasificadas heladas de diversas marcas y sabores, también golosinas en variadas presentaciones. Para esto cuenta con una pequeña bodega  que logro acondicionar en su propia casa, viendo las necesidades de sus vecinos y transeúntes, busco  generar para si un ingreso económico,  motivo que tuvo para a abrir su bodega donde su esposa atiende muy amablemente.
Paralelamente se dedica al transporte contando con automóvil de su propiedad.
Empezó  con su negocio de ventas hace más de 01 año, tiempo con el cual logró hacerse conocido entre sus vecinos y ganarse así una regular clientela.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la ganancias que le deja, pues tiene una regular clientela que siempre le compran sus productos.
Le gusta su actividad  pues le permite contar con los ingresos económicos, además el tiempo que le deja libre lo dedica al trasporte, el cual le genera otros ingresos económicos, con el cual apoya a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. 
Por tanto, tiene planes de  hacer incrementar el stock de sus productos y diversificar su variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 06  con la institución MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más seguro de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes con personas responsables y muy solidarios
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará  más variedad de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas.. Buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa podrá ser más competitivo en relación a precios y tener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Jose is 62 years old and is a very friendly and simple man.  He is married to 60 year old Sarela, with whom he shares his home, which he built on land that he and his wife bought together.  He is a father of one adult daughter who he educated and raised.  He currently lives with his wife, his daughter and her husband, and one grandson.  They all contribute toward the household expenses.

Jose sells cold carbonated soft drinks of different brands and flavors.  He also sells various types of snacks.  To do this he has a small shop that he set up in his home.  Having seen his neighbors’ and transients’ needs, he looked for a way to generate an income, so he opened this shop where his wife happily serves customers.

He also provides transportation services with his car.

He began his selling business more than a year ago, became known among his neighbors, and won regular customers. 

He considers his business to be profitable because he has steady customers who always buy from him.

He likes what he does because it lets him count on an income and also leaves him time to do transportation, which generates other income with which he supports his wife and other household expenses.  Therefore he plans to increase his stock of products and diversify so he can welcome more customers.  This will be his sixth loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have financial backing and feels more comfortable advancing with his work. He also promises to be on time with his payments as with previous loans.  He is also happy to be part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible and united.

He will use the 2,000 PEN from this loan to buy carbonated drinks and snacks.  He is looking for volume prices so he can be more competitive in prices and have better sales.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old and married to Naomi. They are blessed with five children. He has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to build his own house on his new land.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old. A business lady, she is single but supports her parents. She has been a tailor for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a staff member. Veronica will use the loan to purchase textile materials and a sewing machine. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her siblings up to university level and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase textile materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from five years to 22 years. She describes herself as a self-motivated woman. She operates an agribusiness where she sells beans, tomatoes, cabbages etc. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenges to be high transportation cost and outbreak of crops diseases which affect her crops while maturing. 

She will use the KES 11,100 loan to purchase a water tank which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to drill at least one borehole  within five years to increase the source of water for to her farm and household chores. In the future, she plans to carry out large scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase a water-harvesting tank.

loans.name: Pancrasia

texts.en:
Pancrasia is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for several years now. 

Pancrasia is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients including meat, vegetables, seasoning, and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to the people in her place.

In the future, Pancrasia hopes to expand her business and save money to reinvest in the same ventures.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients including meat, vegetables, seasoning, and others.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 27 years old. A business man, he is married to Dorcas who is a business lady. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 21,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alfred will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business he will boost the business. 

His hopes and dreams are to educate his child and buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angel Jesus

texts.es:
Angel e sun joven de 22 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de frejoles, maiz, enter otros. Angel es muy trabajador, desde muy temprano acude a cu centro de labores ya que trabaja como instalador de sensores para una pequeña empresa de su ciudad y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres ya que ellos no tienen muchos ingresos. Angel cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de hacer las cosas bien y salir adelante.

Angel esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra realziar la construccion de un baño en su vivienda  de material noble ya que debido a que su vivivienda es de adobe( ladrillos de barro y paja), la humedad esta erosionando las paredes y es peligroso porque en un determinado tiempo podria derrumbarse; de esta manera el podra brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir lcuando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder seguir apoyando a sus padres".
texts.en:
Angel is 22 years old and lives alongside his parents in the city of Imperial, which is characterized by a very warm and comfortable climate. Agriculture is the most important industry in Imperial, especially the cultivation of beans and corn, among other crops. 

Angel is very hardworking. Beginning in the early morning, he works as a sensor installer for a small company in his city. With the fruits of his labor, he supports his parents, because they do not have much income. Angel believes that his job is going well because he is very responsible, and especially because he has the desire to do things well and be successful.

Angel is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to construct a bathroom from good materials in his home. Since his home is made of adobe (bricks made of mud and straw), the humidity is eroding the walls and it is dangerous because the house could collapse at any given time. In this way, he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family and continue fighting to make his greatest dream come true: "to study at university and continue supporting his parents."

loans.use: to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Rosset

texts.en:
Rosset is a forty-five-year-old woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a farmer and specifically she grows cocoa. 

In order to optimally provide for her family she decided to venture into a clothing business so as to meet the daily expenses. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes affect the business while her dream is to own a boutique. Rosset intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
wilmer e sun joven de 19 años de edad, quien vive al aldo de su pareja y con la cual tienen un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, a quien quiere muchisimo y por quien ahora lucha cada día para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo porque quiere darle lo que el nunca tuvo. Debido a sus pocos recursos economicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educacion secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Mecanica automotriz.

Dia a día Wilmer trabaja como repratidor de bebidas gaseosas, el labora alrededor de 8 horas al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos de su hogar; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsabvle y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Wilmer esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que realziar refaccione en el techo ya que empieza la temporada de lluvias y con ello evitara inundaciones en su vivienda, de esta manera podra brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y segurie luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener uan carrera y poder brindarle una buena educacion a su hijo".
texts.en:
Wilmer is 19 years old. He lives with his girlfriend, with whom he has a 2-year-old son. He loves his son very much and wants to fight every day to offer him a better quality of life, especially because he wants to give him what he never had himself. Due to his limited resources, he could only study up to the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study auto mechanics.

Every day, Wilmer works as a soft drinks deliveryman. He works about 8 hours per day, and with the fruits of his labor he covers his home expenses. He believes that his job is going well because he is very responsible, and especially because he has the desire to succeed.

Wilmer is very grateful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to his home and refurbish the ceiling, because the rainy season is coming and he will then be able to avoid floods in his house. In this way, he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family and  continue working to make his greatest dream come true: "to have a career and to be able to give his son a good education."

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en: Floride is 43 years old. She is a widow with four children. Her oldest child is 19 years old, and the youngest is 4 years old. She has been in business for 19 years, and she wants a loan to buy more food items such as bananas and sweet potatoes to sell. The profits will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy food such as bananas and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol.  She is a married woman and a mother of six young children.  She has been in the rice farming business with her husband for over 13 years.  This is the source of their income.

Perla is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  This will allow them to improve their plants and harvest, thus augmenting their yield and profit.  In the future, Perla hopes to improve their farming business and to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 43 years old.  She is married with one child who is seven years old.  Her husband is a commissioner.  She has been in business for one year.  She wants a loan to buy more vegetables for sale, such as carrots and tomatoes.  With the profit she will renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 30 years old and married with no children.  He wants a loan to buy more food for sale, such as sugar, oil, rice, and potatoes.  He has been in this retail business for three years.  With the profits from this business he will build a house.

loans.use: to buy food for sale.

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia María de  70 años de edad, madre soltera del municipio de la Paz Centro, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro se caracteriza por su comida típica de la región  como “El quesillo y el tiste” ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de tortillas y frijoles en su casa de habitación del cual tiene 42 años de dedicarse a dicha actividad, actividad que la desempeña con gusto ya que hasta la fecha ha podido desempeñarla y ha sido su fuente de trabajo y de su familia. Elia María se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable, trabajadora, de buenas costumbres. En los créditos anteriores ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como el maíz, leña, comal, bolsas plásticas, gas,  cal. Elia María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digna.
texts.en: Elia Maria is 70 years old and a single mother from the town of La Paz Centro, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  La Paz Centro is characterized by its typical food for the region such as “quesillo” [stuffed tortilla] and “tiste” [a drink made from cacao and corn].  She earns a living by selling tortillas and beans in her house, which she has been doing for 42 years and it is an activity that she performs with pleasure because up until now she has been able to perform it and it has been a source of work for her and her family.  Elia Maria is characterized as being a responsible, hard-working and well-mannered person.  With the previous loans she has demonstrated her responsibility by paying on time.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital to buy the primary materials needed for making tortillas, such as corn, firewood, a griddle, plastic bags, gas, and lime.  Elia Maria appreciates the help that the Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have sources of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy the primary materials needed for making tortillas such as corn, firewood, gas, lime, plastic bags and a griddle.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, tomo la decisión de solicitar otro crédito, surgiendo la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de tomates, cebollas, papas, frutas, pepino, etc. El crédito anterior  le ayudo a poseer  un mayor inventario, obtener más ingresos  y fortalecer más el negocio. Sus condiciones económicas han mejorado su condición familiar se mantiene igual.
texts.en:
María decided to request another loan because she needed to improve her income. The money will be invested in the purchase of tomatoes, onions, potatoes, fruit, cucumbers, and other types of produce.

Her previous loan helped her acquire more inventory. As a result, she generated more profit and strengthened her business. Her financial situation has improved and the condition of her family has stayed the same.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, fruit, cucumbers, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Norbelina

texts.es: Norbelina de 68 años de edad, madre soltera con 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad, e independiente económicamente. Ella es originaria del municipio de Telica el cual está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Telica es un pueblo muy acogedor, con gente muy trabajadora.  Gracias a su capacidad de emprendedora  Norbelina tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 32 años que se desempeña en dicha actividad. Desafiando día  a día todos los problemas, y obstáculo con espíritu de superación, y perseverancias. Y hasta hoy en día ha sido de medio de vida y su fuente de ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería en la compra y venta de productos comestible como: sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, aceite,  detergente, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Norbelina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Norbelina is a 68-year-old single mother of five children, all adults and financially independent. She is originally from the Telica municipality which is located in the west of the country. Telica is a cozy town with hardworking people. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial nature, Norbelina operates a store located in her home, which she has done for 32 years. Every day she faces problems and obstacles with the will to overcome and persevere. To this day it has been her livelihood and source of income. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store for the purchase and sale of food products such as: coffee packets, shampoo packets, sugar, milk, bread, beans, oil, detergent, eggs, juice, sodas. Norbelina is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to poor countries such as Nicaragua and people with limited resources so they can have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store for the purchase and sale of food products such as coffee packets, shampoo packets, sugar, milk, bread, beans, oil, detergent, eggs, juice, sodas.

loans.name: Virginia Soledad

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo de 1 año, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padres y madre para él, lamentablemente Virginia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser maestra, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar diversos potajes y dulces.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Virginia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Virginia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una refrigeradora y una cocina, los cuales le servirán de mucho ya que podrá conservar y preparar sus alimentos, de esta manera Virginia mejorar la salud e higiene de ella y su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Virginia, who is 37, lives in the city of Ica with her one-year-old son whom she loves dearly and who is the centre of her world.  She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all her energy to supporting her little one, as she is father and mother to him.  Unfortunately Virginia was not able to study for a professional career, but she would very much have liked to be a primary teacher.  In her free time she enjoys cooking different stews and sweets.   On her own initiative, with a great deal of commitment and dedication, Virginia works in the fields at a farm in his city.  Every day, from the very early hours of the morning, she does this job and can work for about 10 hours.  She is happy in her work and believes that she does well on account of her commitment and the friendly way in which she treats others.  Virginia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because their help will enable her to buy a fridge and a cooker, which will be very useful in allowing her to preserve and prepare her food.  This will mean that Virginia will improve her own and her family's health and hygiene and will continue working and endeavouring to fulfil her great dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a cooker

loans.name: Judith Dionela

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y su pequeño hijo de un año, a quienes ama  son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Judith se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Arqueología, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Judith trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de toldos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de  horas, adicionalmente también vende gaseosas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus  clientes.
Judith se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina y diversos abarrotes, ya que adicionalmente desea iniciar un negocio de venta de abarrotes, de esta manera Judith podrá tener mejor acondicionado y abastecido su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Judith, 26, lives in the city of Ica with her parents and her one-year-old son. She loves them and they are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who puts all her effort into advancing her family. Thanks to her effort and her parents' support, Judith is studying for a professional degree in Archaeology. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes she makes a delicious Arroz Chaufa (fried rice with vegetables) to share with her family. 

Thanks to a lot of determination, dedication, and the support of her parents, Judith has a small business selling awnings. She works every day. She also sells soft drinks. She likes her work and believes that it is going well because of her friendly treatment towards her customers. Judith is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a display case and assorted groceries since she also wants to open a grocery store. This way, Judith can have a better-prepared and better-stocked business. She will continue working and striving her achieve her big dream, which is to completely finish construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and assorted groceries

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
This is Nelsa. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a large quantity and variety of groceries and other products for her business. Her earnings helped her to pay for her children’s education and her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. She and her husband work hard to continuously support their family's needs.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better because having more items to sell will result in more profit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial improvement with a thankful and happy heart. 

Nelsa hopes to have good health and dreams to send all of her children to school. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Hishignyam

texts.en:
Hishignyam, a 48-year-old widow, lives with her three children in a small house in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her son, Nyamhatan, age 20, and daughter, Namjilmaa, age 19, are university students. Youngest daughter, Myadagdemberel, age 12, goes to a local school.

Hishignyam has been running her tailoring service business since 2001. She is well-experienced and a well-known tailor in town. 

She is now requesting MNT 2,500,000 to purchase construction and insulation materials to renovate and insulate her house, to stay warm during the cold, Mongolian winter. Hishignyam is a responsible and hard-working woman.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation materials to renovate and insulate her house, to stay warm during the cold, Mongolian winter.

loans.name: Edwin Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy variado y sobre todo proque se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de frejoles, maíz, entre otros. Edwin vive a lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchisimo y apoya con el fruto de su trabajo. Debido a sus pocos recursos economicos Edwin solo pudo estudiar hasta el primer grado de educacion secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho el poder estudiar la carrera de Ingenieria Mecanica.

Dia a dia Edwin trabaja como obrero agricula en un fundo de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo proque es muy responsable y porque tiene muchs ganas de poder salir adelnate y ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Edwin esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra comprar materiales como maderas, plasticos, entre otros para poder realizar refacciones al techo de la vivienda don de habita ya que estamos en veranmo y las lluvias son muy fuertes y con ello evitaria inundaciones, asi podra mejorar su calidad de vida y seguri luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" poder estudiar y llegar a tener una carrera tecnica".
texts.en: Edwin is a young man of 20.  He lives in the city of Imperial which is known for its very varied climate and its agriculture, especially the cultivation of beans and corn, among other things.   Edwin lives next door to his beloved parents whom he helps with the fruit of his labour.  As money was tight, Edwin was only able to study until the first year of secondary education, but he would very much have liked to gain a qualification in Mechanical Engineering.    Every day, Edwin works as farm labourer on a farm in his city and can work for 10 hours a day.  He believes that he does well in his work because he is very responsible and because he has such determination to succeed and make his parents proud.  Edwin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the help they have given him, he will be able to buy material such as wood and plastic, among other things, which he will use to carry out repairs to the roof of his house.   Now that summer is here and the rain is very heavy, this will enable him to prevent flooding.  As a result, he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue striving to fulfil his great dream: "to be able to study and pursue a technical career.

loans.use: to buy materials such as plastics and wood, among other things

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 64-year-old farmer in Nkubu county, in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children. All the children have cleared schooling. He has been in farming for the past 20 years, producing milk, bananas, maize, and beans, which he sells locally at his nearby market. He runs a chemist shop as an additional source of income.

Andrew is requesting a KES 70,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase veterinary products for sale at his shop, which will help him get extra cash to uplift his livelihood. He aspires to open another veterinary shop in the next five years.

Scarcity of funds and poor transport channels are his major challenges in farming. Andrew believes he will boost his veterinary practices with the aid of Juhudi Kilimo funds.

loans.use: to purchase products for his veterinary shop.

loans.name: Vilma Milagros

texts.es:
vilma es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual se caracteriza pro tener un clima muy calido y tambien por ser visitada por muchos personas de diversas partes del mundo debido a su atractivos turisticos. Vilma vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchsimo y por los cuales se esfuerza cada dia para que ellos se sientan muy orgullosos de ella. 

con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo dedicacion Vilma trabaja vendiendo refrescos y raspadillas en un triciclo por las calles de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 25 clientes al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su carrera ya que actualmente ella se encuentra estudiando la carrra Tenica de Contabilidad; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con lso cleintes y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Vilma esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podra comprar vitrinas nuevas y madera para poder acondicionar y refaccionar su trcicilo para sehuir vendiendo sus productos, de esta manera ella pdora tener los implementos necesarios para poder trabajar y sobre todo poder seguir lcuahdno para poder realziar su mas grande sueño:" poder terminar su carrera y tener su casa propia".
}
texts.en:
Vilma is 19 years old and lives in the city of Nazca, which is characterized by a very warm climate and also as a destination visited by many people from all over the world because of its tourist attractions. Vilma lives with her parents, whom she loves very much, and she strives each day to make them proud of her.

With hard work and above all, dedication, Vilma sells sodas and  raspadillas (shaved ice drinks) on a tricycle through the streets of her city. She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 25 customers a day. With the fruits of her labor she can cover the costs of her studies as she is currently studying accounting. She believes that her business is doing well because she is friendly to her customers and eager to get ahead.

Vilma is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they have given her, she can buy new display cases  and wood to renovate  her tricycle so she can continue selling her product. This way, she can have the necessary equipment to work and above all to continue striving for her greatest dream: to finish her degree and own a home.

loans.use: to buy display cases, wood, etc.

loans.name: Hermelinda Facunda

texts.es:
Hermelinda vive en la ciudad de Ica, es madre soltera y saca delante con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo cariño a sus 3 hijos, quienes para ella on lo mejor que le ha brindado Dios y son su razon y su motor para vivir. Hermelinda es muy trabajadora, ella se dedica su negocio como agricultora, ella trabaja en su campo de cultivo alrededor de 8 horas al dia ya que actualmente ha sembrado algodon, y esta clase de cultivo requiere mucho cuidado, sobre todo regado, arado, entre otros; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque esmuy dedocada en todo lo que el hace.

Hermelinda esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podra comprar abono y tambien poder solventar los gastos de regadio y arado, de esta manera ella podra tener un mejor cultivo y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera ella podra seguir luchando ccada dia para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener una mejo calidad de vida y sobre todo poder apoyar a su familia".
texts.en:
Hermelinda lives in the city of Ica.  She is a single mother, and with great effort and affection, she provides for her children, who, to her, are the best that God has given her, and are her reason for living.

Hermelinda is very hard-working. She makes her living in her business as a farmer.  She works in her fields around 8 hours a day.  She has just planted cotton, and this type of crop requires a lot of care, above all watering and ploughing, among others.  She believes that her business is going well because she is very responsible and above all, is very dedicated to everything she does.

Hermelinda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support, she will be able to buy fertilizer and also cover the costs of irrigation and ploughing.  In this way, she will be able to have a better crop and will be able to improve her earnings.  This will allow her to continue striving everyday to realize her greatest dream:  "To have a better quality of life and above all, to be able to support her family."

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for irrigation, among other things.

loans.name: Los Exitosos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS EXITOSOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Clara ella es casada y tiene 37 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia realiza trabajo en lana como guantes y gorros, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares donde vende la artesanía, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde se pueda vender la artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas de colores, palitos de tener y telas.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de productos de belleza y negocio de servicio de taxi.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers are part of the Communal Bank “Los Exitosos” (The Successful Ones). The bank is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

One of the borrowers is Sra. Clara. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. Clara works at her business of selling handicrafts. She produces items made of wool, such as mittens and caps. Clara works as an independent vendor, offering her products to different establishments that sell handicrafts. She has been in this business for seven years and has done very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell handicrafts. Clara is requesting a loan so that she can buy colored wool, knitting needles, and fabrics.

The other members engage in business activities such as operating a restaurant, managing a grocery store, selling beauty products, and providing taxi services.

Clara is grateful to those who have fulfilled her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy colored wool, knitting needles, and fabrics.

loans.name: Patrick.

texts.en:
Patrick is a sixty-one-year-old married man with nine children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a bar for twelve years and with the proceeds he was able to pay school fees for his children. He also earns from rentals and agriculture.

Inadequate capital and customers not returning the crates on time is his major challenge while his business plan is a big bar and venturing into mechanized agriculture. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Juana De Arco Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo "Juana de Arco" conformado por 7 socias muy emprendedoras y dinámicas. La Sra. Celia es la presidenta del grupo, actualmente tiene 45 años, es separada pero tiene 02 hijos. Celia es una mujer audaz es por eso que decidió emprender un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, actualmente le va muy bien y tiene el apoyo de sus dos hijos. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería y poder abastecer su pequeño negocio. Ella junto a las demás integrantes del grupo "JUANA DE ARCO" agradecen a KIVA, EDAPROSPO y los diferentes inversionistas por la confianza depositada en ellos.

La Sra. Celia es la mujer que viste un polo de color morado con plomo y esta situada en la parte central de la foto.
texts.en:
The group "Juana de Arco" is made up of seven enterprising and dynamic members.  Celia is the president of the group.  She is forty-five years old and has two children.  She is separated from her husband.

She is an audacious woman, which led to her decision to open a small business selling candy. Business is currently going very well, and she has the support of her two sons.  She is seeking this loan in order to buy merchandise to supply her small business.  

Along with the other members of her group, she would like to thank Kiva, EDAPROSPO, and all of the lenders for the confidence they have shown in her group.

Celia is the woman wearing a purple and grey-striped shirt and standing toward the center of the photo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is 53 years old. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a farmer. She is trying to improve her family's living conditions since her husband’s income is small. With this aim, she wants to open her own business. She completed a course called "To get Ahead," held by a women's organization, and learned enough business skills. She plans to set up an animal husbandry business because she likes animals and she has enough skills to raise animals. Her sons and her daughters-in-law will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan of 500 Somoni to buy cattle to set up her new business. Using the loan, she will reach her goal and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities in order to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to set up a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Ruela

texts.en:
Ruela is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of a 4-year-old daughter. She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than four years now. Her husband works in a security firm. 
Ruela is applying for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her inventory and attract and cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Ruela dreams of expanding her store to generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 33-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two young children. She has been in the farming business for several years now. Her husband is a vehicle driver.
Susan is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the labor for the field.
