With this, she will be able to improve the output and harvest of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. Susan hopes of expanding her business in the future and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the labor for the field

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Ubay, Bohol.  She has been engaged in rice farming with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.
Violita is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and increase their harvest and yield. Violita hopes of expanding their farming business in the future and saving money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu, 27, ended her education in the 6th grade. She is hardworking and determined when it comes to her business.  She has been involved in this business for the past eight years. She sells rice, palm oil, cooking oil, vita, pepper, and many other items. Fatu is a mother with two children, ages 2 and 5 years old. They live with her in Buchanan, a town noted for fishing. Only one of the children attends school. Fatu works eleven hours a day and transports her goods by taxi to her business. She make a profit when she sells and uses the profit to buy more goods for the business. She requests this loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, cooking oil, and vita to sell in her business. Her dream is to educate her children and build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, cooking oil, and vita to sell

loans.name: Mariella Margod

texts.es:
Mariella es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus dos pequeños hijos a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus pequeños; gracias a su esfuerzo Mariella pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho, lamentablemente no ha tenido mucha suerte y no ha podido encontrar trabajo en este rubro, en sus ratos libres le gusta le gusta jugar con sus pequeños
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mariella trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella vende diversos productos de primera necesidad, Mariella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Mariella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento, ladrillos, arena y otros, de esta manera ella podrá hacer el cercado y tarrajeo de la parte trasera de su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Mariella is a 31-year-old woman who lives in the city of Huaraz with her two small children, whom she loves and who are her main focus in life.  She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who makes every effort to get her little ones ahead.  Thanks to her hard work, Mariella was able to study law, but unfortunately she has not had much luck and has not been able to find work in this field.  In her free time she likes to play with her little ones.

Thanks to her own initiative, Mariella works at her small grocery business with a great deal of effort and dedication.  She sells different kinds of necessities.  Mariella works every day starting early in the morning and she can go for about 12 hours.  She feels comfortable doing her work and she thinks it is going well because of the nice way she treats her customers. 

Mariella is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks, sand, and others.  These will allow her to build and plaster the enclosure at the back of her house.  She will keep working and applying herself to achieve her great dream of seeing her children become good professionals and good men.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 66 years old, a farmer and is married to David, a businessman. They are blessed with seven children. She has been raising pigs for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. Gladys will use the loan to buy more piglets and feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a pig farm and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Joselyn Milagros

texts.es:
Joselyn es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Joselyn no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Joselyn trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y honestidad.
Joselyn se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño terreno, en el cual desea construir un pequeño cuarto donde pueda vivir, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Joselyn is 19, single, and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Joselyn has not been able to pursue a professional career, but she would really like to. In her spare time, she likes to keep working and sometimes she cooks delicious noodles to share with her family.

Of their own volition, with much effort and dedication, Joselyn works providing cleaning services at a transportation service in the city. She works every day from early in the morning and works for about 8 hours. She believes that she is doing well due to her responsibility and honesty.

Joselyn is grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help she has received, she can purchase a small plot of land where she wants to build a small apartment where she can live, so she will continue to work and strive to succeed and achieve her dream of owning a home.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, 43, is determined and hard-working. She has been selling oranges, peanuts,and bananas from a tray that she has been carrying around for seven years. She is married  and a mother of four children between the ages  of 4 and  20; they live at Buchanan with their mother and are attending school. Her husband gave her the  initial capital to start in this business, and she sells ten hours a day, and makes a profit when she sells. She uses the profit to buy more goods to improve  the  business, and she also thanks the lenders  for  their support toward her business. She has requested this loan to purchase more bananas, oranges, and peanuts to increase her sales, and hopes to give her  children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, and peanuts to increase her sales

loans.name: Dina Sendy

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer de23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Dina pudo estudiar una carrera técnica de cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar, en especial unos riquísimos Tallarines Verdes, el cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Dina trabaja en su pequeño salón de belleza, ella brinda servicios de corte de cabello, maquillaje, manicura y pedicura, Dina trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen servicio y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Dina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de espejos y sillas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para acondiciones su negocio y atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dina is 23 years old, single, and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and her siblings.  She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to better herself.  Thanks to the hard work and support of her parents, Dina was able to study cosmetology.  In her free time she likes to cook, especially delicious green tagliatelle, which is her favorite food.

Dina works at her small beauty salon on her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication.  She offers hairstyling, makeup, manicures, and pedicures.  Dina works every day starting early in the morning and she can go for around 10 hours.  She thinks she is doing well because of the quality of her services and because she treats her clients well.

Dina is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy mirrors and chairs.  These will go a long way toward improving the set-up of her business and they will allow her to see more clients.  She will keep working and applying herself so she can get ahead and achieve her greatest dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy mirrors and chairs

loans.name: Luz Ezequiela

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo, a quien ama y agradece todo su apoyo, ella es una persona  muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Luz no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta coser y bordar, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Adobo de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luz trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de hamburguesas y pollo broaster, adicionalmente ella tiene una pequeña bodega, donde vende productos de primer necesidad, Luz trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luz se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abarrotes, tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, golosinas, aceite y otros, de esta manera Luz tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener una vida larga y plena al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Luz is a 62 year old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her husband who she loves and appreciates for all his support. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to overcome. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and because she had to work to support her parents, Luz was not able to study for a professional degree. However, she would very much have liked to do so. In her free time, she likes to sew and embroider and sometimes to cook a tasty chicken in adobo sauce to share with her family.
On her own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Luz works in her own business selling hamburgers and fried chicken. She also has a small grocery shop where she sells staple goods. Luz works every day from the early hours and works for about 8 hours. She believes she is doing well because of her good flavors and the kind treatment that she gives to her customers. 
Luz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help offered, she will be able to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, legumes, candy, oil, and others. In this way, Luz will have a better supplied store and will be able to serve more customers. So, she will be able to keep working and striving to be successful and to achieve her great dream of having a long and full life alongside her husband.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, legumes, candy, oil, and others.

loans.name: Mwajumbe

texts.en:
Mwajumbe has a partner who works as a businessman and two children in school. She lives in the town of Msambweni, in a place that has a high potential for tourism because of the beautiful beaches of the Indian Ocean.

She's a merchant who makes a living with an eatery and selling snacks. Her business is in the market where she serves a good number of people who come to this shopping center. 

She'll use the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and various vegetables. Her goal is to give her customers better service.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and various vegetables

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en: Amiel is 33 years old. He is married with two children. The older is six years old and the younger is three. His wife is also a businesswoman. He has been in business for five years selling rice, sugar, cooking oil and soap. He wants a loan to add more of these items. The profits from the business are meant for his savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and soap for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children, whose ages range from 11 to 22. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for several years now. Her husband operates a chainsaw machine. These are the sources of their income.

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to buy spare parts for the chainsaw. With this, Rebecca and her husband will be able to improve their income, allowing them to provide the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and spare parts for the chainsaw

loans.name: Soledad Zenaida

texts.es:
Soledad es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Soledad no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que desea, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Soledad trabaja día a día como empleada del hogar, ella realiza labores de limpieza, cocina, lavado y otros, Soledad puede trabajar por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y honestidad.
Soledad se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de panetones y juguetes, ya que al acercarse la época navideña desea iniciar un pequeño negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda lograr su sueño de tener su propia boutique de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Soledad, 20, is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic young woman with a big desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, because she lacks financial resources and needs to work, Soledad hasn't been able to study to be a nurse as she would like, but she would very much like to do so.  In her free time she likes to watch movies, and sometimes she cooks a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Soledad works every day as a domestic employee.  She cleans, cooks, washes clothes, and does other tasks.  Soledad can work approximately eight hours, and she believes it's going well for her because of her responsibility and honesty.

Soledad is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy panettone and toys.  With the Christmas season approaching, she wants to start a small business.  This way she'll be able to continue working and making the effort so that in the near future she can realize her dream of having her own clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy panettone and toys

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is a 62-year-old fish vendor from Ubay, Bohol. She is a mother of eight grown-up children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Priscila is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving her more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Priscila dreams of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: Saludos cordiales. Este es el nuevo grupo “Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay” conformado por 13 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Irma una de las socias es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. A sus 31 años ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus metas como mantener su negocio y comprar su vivienda. Hace más de 01 año que se dedica a la venta de picarones con café. Este negocio le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida la de ella y su pequeño. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Este crédito lo solicito para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar, café y juguetes para que pueda ofrecer por campaña navideña. El nuevo grupo “Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay” agradece el crédito brindado. Irma se encuentra sentada, es la segunda del lado derecho viste una casaca floreada y pantalón azul.
texts.en: Greetings! This is the new group Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay, comprised of 13 members who are eager to start work. Irma, one of the members, is separated and has one dependent son. In her 31 years, she has has been able to achieve some of her goals such as having her own business and buying her home. For more than 1 year she has worked selling pumpkin donuts and coffee. This business has enabled her to improve the quality of life for her son and herself. Her next goal is finish building her house. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and coffee and toys that she can offer during the Christmas campaign. The new group Tayta Cruz de Muruhuay is grateful for the loan they are being offered. Irma is seated second from the right wearing a flowered jacket and blue pants.

loans.use: To buy supplies like flour, sugar, coffee, and toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tires and perform maintenance on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 54-year-old married man with nine children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop which he started in order to supplement his cocoa business, which is seasonal. His clients are middle-men and the cocoa factory which is twenty kilometers away from his farm. 

Insufficient funds to meet the high demand and unpredictable seasonal weather changes affect his business. His business plan is to own a wholesale shop. Jackson intends to use this loan to buy merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario earns a living by running a sari-sari or variety store business. She has been operating the business for several years now in her place in Ubay, Bohol. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her locality.

Rosario is asking for a loan to buy additional stock items to sell in her store like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, snack foods, beverages and other products. With this, she will be able to enhance her inventory and cater to more buyers in her store.

In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, soda, soap and toiletries, snack foods, beverages and other products

loans.name: Ana Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Ofelia esta casada, tienen 23 años de edad, curso los 2 años de educación básica, tiene un hijos, se dedica  a la confección de delantales de típicos, trabajo que aprendió con amigos que tiene, hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a oficio de jornalero y  la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas de cortes, adornos e hilos, ya que quier aumentar su producción de delantales, espera en el futuro tener mas venta y la manera para cumplir su objeto por medio de un préstamo, para luego hacer una recuperación pero con ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Ofelia is married and she is 23 years old.  She completed two years of primary education.  She has one child.  She sews traditional aprons for a living, having learned how to do this work from friends.  She currently has three years of experience and she also has the support of her husband, who works as a day laborer and supports her financially.   

She is asking for a loan to buy yards of fabric, decorations, and thread, as she wants to increase her production of aprons.  She hopes to have better sales in the future and she plans on achieving this through her loan by making enough to repay it with money left over.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Juan Antonio es soltero, tienen 24 años de edad, esta graduado de maestro de deportes, se dedica a jugar fútbol en una federación deportiva, lleva ya 6 años con este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Solicita un préstamo, que lo utilizara para la compra de implemento, camisolas, pantaloneras, protectores de rodilla, guantes, gorras, las cuales utilizara en la federación donde juega, espera seguir entrenando y poder cumplir su sueño de ser un jugador reconocido a nivel nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
This young man is Juan Antonio. He is single and 24 years old. He has a degree in sports. He is dedicated to playing soccer in a sports league. He has been doing this for six years and has the support of his family.

He is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase items like shirts, shorts, knee pads, gloves, and caps that are used in the league where he plays. He hopes to continue training and to fulfill his dream of being a recognized soccer player at a national and international level.

loans.use: to pay for items needed to play.

loans.name: Welgelmina

texts.en:
Welgelmina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages twenty, fifteen, and two. She lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business along with her husband for almost ten years now. This is the source of their income.

Welgelmina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks and lead weights. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, thus giving them more to sell in the market.

In the future, Welgelmina hopes to make their business a success in order to save money for reinvestment in the same venture and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks and lead weights

loans.name: Aloisiah

texts.en:
Aloisiah is a 42-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is married to John, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Aloisiah is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a staff member. Aloisiah will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams include venturing into the zero-grazing farming business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Isabel Paula

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la ciaudad de Ica la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima calido y por el desarrollo de la agricultura, en especial el cultivo d ealgodon, paprika, uva, entre otros. Isabel ha enfrentado duras pruebas, hace algunos años quedo viuda y para ella fue una perdida muy grande ya que queria mucho a su esposo, pero saco muchas fuerza y desidio no dejarse vencer y salir adelante.  con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Isabel logro iniciar su negocio de venta de emolientes, ella se levanta muy temprano ppara trabajar ya que mayomente ofrece sus productos a las personas que van a trabajar a los fundos, ella cree qu ele va bien en su negocio porque atiende a sus clientes d emanera amable y porque tiene un angel que nunca la abandona el cual es su esposo.

isabel esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra realziar mejoras en su vivienda como refaccionar las paredes agrietadas, mejorar el techo de su vivienda entre otros; de esta manera ella podra mejorar sus calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder realizar su mas grande sueño:" Tener una mejor calidad de vida y ser una gran empresaria
texts.en:
Isabel is 54 years old. She lives in the city of Ica which is characterized by its hot climate and by its agricultural development, especially the cultivation of cotton, paprika, and grapes, among others. Isabel has faced hard tests in life and some years ago she was left a widow and it was a great loss for her as she loved her husband very much. But, she found strength and decided not to be defeated and to move ahead. With much dedication and saving, Isabel was able to start her business selling moisturizers. She gets up very early in order to work as she mostly sells to people who go to work on the farms. She believes that she has done well with her business because she attends to her customers in a kind way and because she has an angel who has never abandoned her and that this is her husband. 
Isabel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help that they have offered, she will be able to improve her home by repairing cracked walls, improving the roof, and other tasks. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and keep fighting to be able to realize her greatest dream: to have a better quality of life and to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: For improvements to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as polo shirts, shorts, tank tops and other items.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto, casado con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originario de la ciudad de León. Lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. José Alberto es un hombre trabajador, de buenas costumbres, con ganas de superación personal, responsables en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en material de construcción para realiza mejoras en su casa de habitación, como es construir la cocina, y cambiar el techo a unos de los cuartos. Y de dicha forma proteger a su familia y brindarles estabilidad. José Alberto agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos para brindar estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en: José Alberto is married and has children in his care. He is originally from the city of León, which is located in the western zone of the country. José Alberto is a working man, with good manners, and with a desire to succeed personally. He is responsible in his repayments in both time and form. The purpose of this loan is to invest in construction material in order to make improvements to his house such as building the kitchen and changing the roof of some of the rooms. In this way he will protect his family and offer them stability. José Alberto is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people who have scarce resources to offer stability to their families.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and to buy construction materials such as zinc, blocks, cement, sand, paint, and lime.

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Sol De Cupiche” conformado por 09 socios, la cual pasan a su 8 ciclo, siendo la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona. Doris de 56 años separada con 06 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 04 de ellos. Ella cuenta con un negocio donde brinda servicio de lavados de carros, con mucho esfuerzo  a llegado a mejorar su negocio ya que actualmente también ofrece golosinas y bebidas. Este negocio surgió con la idea de poderles brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos, es por ello que se esfuerza. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos profesionales. Solicito el crédito para la compra de artículos de limpieza de autos y golosinas.  La Alcancía Comunal “El Sol De Cupiche” agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa-Prosperidad. Doris se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierda viste chaleco plomo y polo manga larga color morado.
texts.en:
This is the group “El Sol De Cupiche” (The sun of Cupiche). It is called that because the vast majority of them are residents of the area. It is made up of 9 members and is in its 8th cycle.

Doris is 56 years old and separated with 6 children. She currently supports 4 of them. She has a business where she offers the service of washing cars. With much effort, she has improved her business, which currently also offers snacks and drinks. This business arose with the idea of being able to provide a better education for her children, which is why she works so hard. Her greatest desire is to see her children become professionals.

She is requesting a loan to buy items to clean cars and sweets. The group “El Sol De Cupiche” is grateful for the provided credit and is committed to continue working well with the program "Prosperidad" (Prosperity). Doris is located in the back, second from the left side, wearing a dark vest with a purple long sleeve shirt.

loans.use: to buy items for cleaning cars and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, yarns and patterns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, such as rice, sugar, oil, dried beans, soft drinks, fruits, candy, etc.

loans.name: Walter Waldemar

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con su pequeño hijo de  cinco años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño,  gracias a su esfuerzo Walter pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, lamentablemente por diversos motivos no ha podido ejercer su profesión, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones come un riquísimo Cuy Chactado, el cual es su comida favorita.
 Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Walter trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y reparación de equipos celulares, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, Walter se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Walter se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de equipos celulares, baterías, audífonos, accesorios y otros, de esta manera él espera poder atender a mas clientes, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Walter is a 43 year old man. He lives in the city of Huaraz with his little 5 year old boy, who he loves and is his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person that has dedicated all of his effort to improve his life a little. Thanks to his effort, Walter could study for the career of systems engineering. Unfortunately, for various reasons, he has not been able to work in that profession. In his spare time, he likes to play soccer with his friends, and sometimes eat a delicious Cuy Chactado, which is his favorite food.

By his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Walter works in his small business selling and repairing cellular equipment. He works every day beginning in the early hours of the morning and works for approximately 12 hours. Walter feels happy doing his work and believes that he is doing well because of the friendly treatment he provides his customers.

Walter is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since, thanks to you, he can purchase a larger quantity of cellular equipment, batteries, headphones, accessories, and other items. In this way, he hopes to be able to serve more customers so he can continue working and striving to achieve his dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy cellular equipment, batteries, headphones, accessories, and others.

loans.name: Katya Karen

texts.es:
Katya es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pareja, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Katya pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Katya trabaja como asistente administrativo en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Katya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir y zapatos de temporada, ya que Katya desea iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Katya is 21 and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her partner. She is a very friendly and enthusiastic worker who has a great desire to excel. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Katya was able to study business administration. In her spare time, she enjoys watching movies and on occasion, she makes a delicious ceviche to share with her family.

Of her own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Katya works as an administrative assistant at a transportation service in the city. She works every day from early in the morning for about 8 hours; she feels comfortable doing her work and believes that she does well due to her good performance and the kindness to others.

Katya is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help she has received, she can buy the season's clothing and shoes. Katya wants to start a small business selling clothes, so she will continue to work and strive to succeed and achieve her dream of owning a home.

loans.use: to buy dresses and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To document a property title.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña María tiene 61 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a su esposo e hijos. Hace 7 años que doña María se ha dedicado a vender mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños mediante pedidos y entrega a domicilio, y en su casa también vende refrescos, churros, dulces y galletas. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, es una señora muy emprendedora, siempre busca como obtener sus ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF para mantener activo su negocio, el cual es por 5,000.00 lempiras y va comprar más refrescos, churros, dulces y ropa para incrementar su inventario y aumentar las ventas. Tiene como meta establecer el negocio en un local céntrico y ampliarlo más.
texts.en:
Doña María is 61 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

For the past seven years, Doña María has been selling merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children. She accepts orders and makes home deliveries. María also sells soft drinks, snack foods, sweets, and cookies. She previously sold tortillas. María is an enterprising woman who always looks for ways to generate income. She decided to request her second loan from ODEF so that she can remain active in her business. The amount of 5,000 HNL will be used to buy more soft drinks, snack foods, candy, and clothing so that she can increase her inventory and her sales.

Her goal is to establish her business in a centralized location and to expand it even more.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, candy, and clothing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 62 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Dhunhill, a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES. 19,000 which she uses to support her family.

Esther is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into zero grazing farming business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 22 años de edad, el cual vive al lado de su madre a quien quiere muchisimo y a quien apoya con el fruto de su trabajo. La viienda de Luis se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un cliam calido y sobre todo se desarrolla mucho la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodon, pallares, enter otros.  Debido a varios problemas economcios el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educacion secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de Ingenieria civil.

Dia a dia Luis trabaja como chofer de taxi, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. 

Luis esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podra realziar un matenimiento general a su vehiculo y tambien poder colocar algunos accesorios al vehiculo como un autoradio, de estama manera tendra un vehiculo en buenas condiciones y podra conducir con mayor seguridad; asi el seguira lucahdno y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:"Tener una empresa de Taxis".
texts.en:
Luis is a young man of 22 who lives with his mother, whom he loves very much and supports through his work.  Luis' home is in the city of Ica, which is known for having a warm climate and above all for farming, especially cotton and lima beans, among others.  Because of various financial difficulties, he was only able to study through the fifth grade, but he would have liked to have studied civil engineering.

Luis works day-to-day as a taxi driver.  He works around 10 hours a day and he can serve up to 15 customers daily.  He uses the fruit of his work to help his mother with the household expenses.

Luis is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to perform routine maintenance on his car and install some accessories, such as a radio.  This will leave him with a car in good condition and he will be able to drive with more confidence.  He will keep fighting and working to make his greatest dream of having a taxi business a reality.

loans.use: to perform car maintenance

loans.name: Maria Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Maria Emiliana esta casada, tiene 44 años de edad, curso, lo 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica al tricotado de hilos, inicio este trabajo gracias al apoyo de una vecina quien le enseño ha hacer este trabajo, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a los oficio de jornalero.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos blanco, para elaborar tricotado, espera mejorar su producción con nuevos diseños, para tener mas posibilidades de captar mas clientes y mejorar su ingresos. Espera en el futuro tener trabajadores en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Emiliana is married and is 44 years old.  She studied 2 years of primary education and has 1 child.  

She makes her living knitting.  She began this work thanks to the support of a neighbor who taught her how to do this type of work.  She now has 10 years of experience.  She counts on the support of her husband, who makes his living as a day laborer.

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy white yarn for knitting.  She hopes to improve her production with new designs in order to increase the possibility of attracting more customers and increase her income.  In the future, she hopes to have employees in her business.

loans.use: to buy yarn for knitting.

loans.name: Gogia

texts.en:
Gogia is 69 years old. He lives alone in the Sagarejo District. Gogia has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for his family business start-up without any success. His loan request has been rejected many times because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. One source of income is his monthly salary working as a watchman, additionally he is provided with a retirement pension. 

Gogia is requesting a loan from Credo to start-up his family business. He will use his loan to purchase piglets to start an animal husbandry business. He will put the piglets in a shed in the yard and raise and sell them for a higher price. Gogia's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country rural poor who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Gogia's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Hace un año que ella ha decidido poner su propio negocio con el fin de obtener otros ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. Ella vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, sal, café, churros, dulces, refrescos, condimentos y otros productos básicos. También hace topogigios (helados) para vender. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,500 lempiras para surtir de productos alimenticios y aumentar sus ventas para obtener más ingresos. Su meta es ampliar el negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 36, is married and has 4 children.  She lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  A year ago, she decided to start up her own business so that she could earn extra income to support her household.  She sells rice, sugar, butter, flour, salt, coffee, chips, sweets, drinks, condiments, and other basic products.  In addition, she makes ice cream to sell.  She has decided to request a loan for 5,500 Honduran lempiras so that she can stock up on food products, increase her sales, and thereby increase her earnings.  Her goal is to expand the business so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and other consumer products, including: butter, sugar, chips, sweets, condiments and other grocery items

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old business lady; she is married to Patrick, a business man. They are blessed with three children.  She has been running a retail shop for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES. 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET, after being introduced by a credit officer. Jane will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal for resale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her shop. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice, maize meal, etc. for her retail store.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 55 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su madre, a quien quiere mucho y agradece todo su apoyo; él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante, lamentablemente y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Oscar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Veterinaria que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros por televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Oscar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, el realiza sus ventas en diversos distritos de su ciudad y puede trabajar por un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Oscar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de panetones y champan, ya que al acercarse la época navideña, adicionalmente desea vender estos productos, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para poco a poco mejorar su vivienda y así lograr su gran sueño de brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su madre.
texts.en:
Oscar is 55, single, and lives in the city of Chincha with his mother, whom he loves and appreciates all her support. He is  kind and enthusiastic worker who devotes all his efforts to getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to the need to work from an early age, Oscar could not study for a veterinary career like he wanted. In his spare time, he enjoys watching news on television and sometimes cooking a delicious carapulcra sopa seca to share with his family.

Of his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Oscar works in his small business selling sweets. He makes sales made ​​in different districts of the city and works for about 8 hours a day. He feels comfortable doing his work and believes that he does well by providing friendly service to his customers.

Oscar is very grateful to the lenders, and thanks to the help he has received, he can buy panettone and champagne. As the holiday season approaches, he wants to sell these products additionally. He will continue to work and strive to gradually improve their housing and achieve his goal of providing a good quality of life for his mother.

loans.use: to buy panettone and champagne.

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es: Doña Nicolasa, es casada, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el municipio de Intibucá. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas como rábano, brócoli, zanahoria, remolacha, culantro, papa, y granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Doña Nicolasa ha decidido solicitar un préstamo en forma grupal para darle mejor asistencia a los cultivos, piensa invertir el préstamo en pesticidas y abonos para poder sacar buena producción. Su plan es agregar otro tipo de hortaliza para incrementar los ingresos de la unidad familiar. El grupo al que pertenece se llama Flor del Campo que esta formado por tres socias que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a cultivar granos básicos y hortalizas. El préstamo grupal es por 18,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en la compra de abonos y pesticidas para darle mantenimiento a los cultivos. En la foto se identifican así: A la izquierda esta valeriana, en medio Nicolasa y a la derecha esta María Leonor.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is married and has 6 children, and she lives in the municipality of Intibuca.  She has been a farmer all of her life, cultivating crops such as: radishes, broccoli, carrots, beets, cilantro, potatoes, and staple grains such as corn and beans.   She sells her products in the local market.  Nicolasa has decided to request a loan as a member of the group to help her with her crops.  She plans to invest this loan in pesticides and organic fertilizers so that she can get a better yield.  Her plan is to add other types of vegetables so that she can increase her family's income.  

The communal bank that Nicolasa belongs to is called "Flor del Campo," and it is made up of 3 members who live in the same community and all work cultivating grains and vegetables.  This group loan is for 18,000 Honduran lempiras, and it will be invested in organic fertilizers and pesticides to help the members maintain their crops.  In the photo, you see Valeriana on the left, Nicolasa in the middle, and Maria Leonor on the right.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and organic fertilizers for her vegetable and potato crops

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a 44-year-old married man with seven children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has been in business for 8 years, dealing in buying and selling local brew, maize, Irish, and milk.

In addition to the above, Ernest has a retail business selling household items like soap, salt, utensils, and sugar, among other things. His business is in a rural area where there is less competition.

He began his business to increase his family income, so he could educate his big family.  He hopes to own a wholesale shop and venture into commercial farming, despite the challenges of inadequate capital and high license fees.

Ernest intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Ms. Riffat   is 32 years old, a married lady and a mother of three, two sons and one daughter. The man shown in the photo is Riffat’s husband; he is a rickshaw driver and makes enough to support his family members. For bearing the expense of the rickshaw, Riffat contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. Through this loan, her husband will be able to purchase a new body for his rickshaw that will allow him to save his business asset and improve his transport service. 

Riffat expects an increase in the net income of her husband and wishes to spend part of it on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new body for his rickshaw

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 52 years old, and from the Zestaponi district. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. 

Tengiz works as a builder when he gets orders. Tengiz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family runs an agricultural business. Specifically, they have two milk cows, and use the milk for cheese production. They sell cheese locally, in an open market at a good price. In addition, Tengiz has a minibus and transports people to get a monthly income.  

It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-ups and re-startups, with credits for soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. 

With the received credit, Tengiz will buy a new minibus, as the existing one is amortized and needs renovation, and the renovation expense exceeds the income of the family. He plans to buy new one, and satisfy his customers with a comfortable minibus. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a minibus

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa de 57 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno, ubicado en le departamento de Bolívar. Ella se dedica a la venta de cervezas y a la elaboración de tabacos y a la venta de mercancía variada, con el fin de apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia  conformada por 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 36 años. Inicialmente se había dedicado a la elaboración de tabacos, actividad que aprendió hace 20 años  con su familiar y hoy  ella compra  el tabaco en bruto lo prepara  y lo promociona  y  vende  en las tiendas. Hace 1 año empezó a vender cervezas y otros refrescos para aumentar mucho más sus ingresos y posteriormente agregó también la mercancía variada especialmente ropa para damas, esta última la vende a crédito y recupera su inversión mensualmente. Su meta es ampliar su negocio para hacer adecuaciones locativas que mejoren las condiciones de su vivienda. Josefa se esfuerza mucho para que esto suceda, pero su capital d e trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la demanda del mercado, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará : cervezas en mayor volumen y ropa femenina que tiene encargada, con estos productos sus clientes disfrutarán las navidades y el año nuevo, elegantes bailando y bebiendo un poco.
texts.en:
Fifty-seven year old Josefa lives in the municipality of San Juan Nepomuceno, situated in the department of Bolívar.  She makes her living selling beer, making cigarettes and selling assorted merchandise in order to support the upkeep of her family, which is made up of 4 children ages 19 to 36 years.

Initially, she made her living making cigarettes, an activity she learned 20 years ago with her family.  Today, she buys uncut tobacco, prepares it, and promotes and sells it in stores.  A year ago, she began selling beer and other refreshments to significantly increase her income.  She later also added assorted merchandise, in particular women's clothing, which she sells on credit and recovers her investment monthly.

Her goal is to expand her business in order to make renovations that will improve the conditions of her housing.  Josefa works very hard so that this will happen, but her working capital is not suffient to respond to market demands.  This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy:  beer in bulk and women's clothing that has been pre-ordered.  With these products, her customers will enjoy the Christmas holidays and the new year, elegant, dancing and drinking a little.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk and women's clothing.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en: Anifa is a thirty three year old married woman living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. She has a cocoa business and a side income from selling spare parts. She has been in business for over 10 years. She started the business in order to afford an education for her children since her husband was not able to earn enough to meet the ever increasing fees. Anifa is a very hardworking client whose dream is to become the leading cocoa producer in the region despite the challenges of having inadequate capital to buy more land for farming. Sometimes she has to buy from other farmers and this limits her profits. She intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a 42 year old married woman with three children living in Bundibugyo,Uganda. She trades in food products and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She started the business so as to meet the daily expenses since farming is very seasonal. Inadequate capital and exploitation by middle men are her great challenges. Her dream is to own a food store since the business is very lucrative. Hadija intends to use the loan to buy food products such as cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products such as cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 62 year old woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She started her business of selling food 30 years and with the proceeds she was able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. Price fluctuation and the unpredictable weather changes pose a challenge to her growth. Her business plan is to set up food stores in at least three towns. Faith intends to use the loan to buy food such as beans and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy food such as beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Hector Amilkar

texts.es:
Héctor con 33  años de edad, originario de Managua, casado, con conocimiento académico universitario, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 2 y  5 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de repuesto de vehículo y vulcanización. Inicio hace 12 años en el ámbito del comercio,  vendiendo lubricantes pero este negocio no le resulto muy rentable porque no le generaba mucho ingreso, fue allí que  decidió establecer otro negocio como es el de reparación y alineación  de llantas, ya que miro que  el lugar era accesible para este negocio el cual le generaba mejores ganancias, este ha sido su primer  negocio, el cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano quien trabaja con el.
El esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar  batería, aceites para carro, llantas, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para su taller. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar más activo fijo  como vitrina, herramientas nuevas y otra variedad de productos que aun no tiene en inventario y de esta manera poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuro es comprar otro terreno para ampliar y poner otro negocio de todo tipo de repuesto, su  meta próxima es poder cambiar las maquinarias de reparación de vehículo que tiene con unas nuevas, y mejorar la infraestructura del local para darle una mejor presentación al local.
texts.en:
Héctor, age 33, is originally from Managua. He is married and has a university education. Héctor is the father of two children, ages 2 and 5 respectively. He is a merchant and has a business where he sells vehicle spare parts and provides tire repair services. Héctor started 12 years ago selling lubricants, but this business was not profitable since he was not able to generate much income. He then started another business repairing and aligning tires. Héctor looked for a place that was available for establishing this business, but he ended up at the location that was used for his first business. His brother helps him with the work.

Héctor is requesting a loan so that he can buy batteries, motor oil, tires, and other products. All of these items are needed in his workshop. He believes the loan will also help him acquire more fixed assets such as a display cabinet, new tools, and a variety of other products that he currently does not have in stock. As a result, he will be able to satisfy the needs of his customers.

Héctor’s future plans include buying another plot of land so that he can expand and open another business that involves selling all types of spare parts. The next items on his priority list include replacing the machinery used for vehicle repairs and improving the infrastructure of his shop so that it will have a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy batteries, motor oil, tires, and other products.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms. Musarat is a 48-year-old married lady. She is successfully doing a business of hand embroidery. She is a very talented and hardworking lady. She has gained years of experience in this field and has gradually improved her standard of living through her business. Her daughter also assists her in completing customers’ orders on time. Musarat makes enough to lead a decent life. 

In order to meet the requirements of her customers, Musarat needs to purchase raw material. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000. 

In this way, she would be able to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in various colors. This would help her to complete the demands of her customers time after time, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in various colors.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Ms. Sakina is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income.

She has been in the business of sewing for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of Rs 20000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. so that she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has two children, both of whom are school going. Her husband deals in a hawker’s business. When she realized that her husband's income was not sufficient to meet all the household expenditures with ease, she and her husband took the initiative of starting a goat selling business. 

Presently, she has four goats and plans to purchase two more goats to earn more profit. For this purpose, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She has a strong association with Kashf, as she has availed herself of loans five times and always paid back her installments on time. 

Her dream is to save enough of money for the marriage of her daughter. She is putting away savings on a daily basis to make it possible.

loans.use: to purchase two goats

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en: Shaista is a 23-year-old woman. She is efficiently running a beauty parlor in her community. Her husband is a rickshaw driver but his income is insufficient to meet the basic needs of their family. Due to this reason, she started her own beauty salon to contribute to the family income to support the needs of her family members. She has two children. She is working hard to provide them with quality food, health and education. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of 30000 PKR to purchase more packs of makeup kits, cleansing products and lipstick. This will help her to cater to more customers time after time. She dreams of providing her children with a good quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of makeup kits, cleansing products and lipstick.

loans.name: Emprendiendo Hacia El Éxito Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos!, Este es el grupo “Emprendiendo hacia el Éxito” conformado por 8 socias caracterizadas por ser muy alegres y luchadoras. La Srta. Susan es socia del grupo, tiene 24 años, soltera y sobre todo muy trabajadora. Ella tiene un negocio de artículos de Ferretería, el cual le genera gran parte de sus ingresos y conjuntamente ofrece sus servicios como docente en un colegio allegado a su casa. El presente préstamo es para la obtención de mercaderías para su negocio de Ferretería y así poder abastecer a toda su clientela. Ella junto a las demás integrantes del grupo agradecen a todas aquellas personas que pudieron ayudarlas mediante KIVA y EDAPROSPO.

La Srta. Susan viste una casaca de color negra y es la primera en la parte de la derecha de la foto.
texts.en:
Greetings from the ‘Emprendiendo hacia el Éxito’ Group! The group has eight members who are known for their cheerfulness and hard work. 

Señorita Susan is one of the members. She is 24 years old, single, and more than anything else, very hardworking. She runs a hardware store which provides the majority of her income. However, she is also a teacher at a school near to her house.

The current loan will be used to buy stock for her hardware business so she is able to offer a wide range of merchandise to all her customers. 

Along with the other group members, Susan wishes to thank those people in Kiva and EDAPROSPO who provide help for her group.

In the photograph Susan is first on the right wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware business

loans.name: Shafiqan

texts.en: Ms. Shafiqan is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a devoted person and efficiently runs a business of vegetable sales with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Shafiqan’s husband. She makes enough money to support her family. She is liable to bear their cost of education, food, and clothing. She needs to expand her business, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase a stock of fresh vegetables including onions, potatoes and tomatoes. Having these vegetables would attract more people to her shop and would earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables such as onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running an embroidery business in her community for the last four years. Her husband works as a clerk but earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Razia’s embroidery designs and patterns are much in demand. She is motivated to provide for her family and wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family members.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 27-year-old widow. She is an active and talented lady who excels in the work of stitching. She has gained years of experience in this field and has gotten a lot of appreciation from the people of her community. She didn’t lose hope after the death of her husband and continued her stitching work to support the needs of her two children. For meeting the requirements of her customers she needs to purchase more spools of thread and packs of lace, buttons and needles. She applied for a loan of PKR 30000 to Kashf Foundation. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is very much thankful to Kashf for its support. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of lace, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 56-year-old widowed lady who supports three children between the ages of 15 and 28. She practices horticulture on her farm, which has been in operation for a period of one year and earns an income of KES 15,000.

Paulina is servicing her fourth loan of KES 22,000 from KADET LTD after she repaid the previous one successfully. She intends to use this amount to till more land and purchase passion seedlings. The profits she gets will be used to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan. She hopes to expand her passion fruit farm.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruit seedlings and tilling

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 10 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

Naseem is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy a stock of rice and flour from the market at lower price and to expand her business. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent credit history. She wishes to spend part of her earnings to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice and flour from the market

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda, 37 years old, is from Gardabani district. Imeda requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times to start a family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for Imeda is working as a guard in a private company. It is hardly enough for food. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Imeda requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the loan, Imeda will purchase sheep. After purchasing the sheep, he plans to expand the number of livestock and increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions for Imeda.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is 32 years old, married, and lives in Batumi with his wife and three children. The source of the family income is the monthly salary earned by Mamuka’s wife working at a non-governmental organization. Mamuka has requested a loan from the local financial institutions for starting up a business but his loan requests have been rejected several times because he lacks experience with new business start-ups and does not qualify for a traditional loan under income requirements. Mamuka is requesting a loan under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and restart-up loans with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers." Mamuka will use his loan to purchase seine and fishing tackle for starting up a fishing business. He has recently bought the hooks and plans to fish in the Black Sea.  He hopes that his business will be profitable and sell many fish at the local open market. By increasing his monthly income, he hopes that the new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seine and fishing tackle for starting up a fishing business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old and a business lady. She is married to Paul, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling fruits for the past seven years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD  after being introduced by a friend who is a registered client of KADET. Jane will use the loan to purchase more fruits to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry for transporting fruits.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 49-year-old farmer who lives in Nkubu county, Kenya with his wife and three children. Two of the children are still in school. Peter has been in farming for the past eleven years producing coffee, bananas and other fruits, and vegetables, which he sells at his local market.

Peter is requesting a KES75,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water tanks for irrigation, which will help him in grow more produce. This will lift his living standards and he can use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling. He also aspires to have purchased one acre of land in the next five years.

Dry spells, pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

Peter says Juhudi Kilimo offers the best services for its clients.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 60-year-old businessman. He is married to Josephine, a businesswoman. They are blessed with four children. Francis has been running a retail shop for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES15,000 that he uses to support his family. 

Francis is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Francis will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his shop. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to sell.

loans.name: Bebi

texts.en:
Bebi considers herself to be a happy person of good character, friendly, and above all very responsible in her work. She lives with her husband and their four children in the town of Msambweni.

Bebi works in food vending, a business she has done for the last six months. It’s going very well; she is very popular among her customers. In order to improve service to her customers, she needs to invest in the purchase of more ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables and cooking fat, among other essential items. With this loan, she will improve attention to her customers and improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables and cooking fat, among other essential items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and a business lady. She is married to Jeremiah who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Grace will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal to sell.  

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize meal etc

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ms Ishrat is 20 years old and married. She has been running a general store with the support of her husband. Her husband has maintained many relationships in the market for buying goods at wholesale rates. They offer various items of goods for daily use. Ishrat has good communication skills and counts a good client list. They are happily doing this together for the sake of their family members. 

Ishrat is a mother of five children, all going to school. In order to make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase sacks of rice, flour, and packs of oil. Due to this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20000. She has been in association with Kashf for four years. She expects an increase in her net income by catering to more customers time after time. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, flour and  oil.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en: Ms Nagina is 21 years old. She has been efficiently doing stitching work for the last five years. She is eager to support her family members by contributing to the family income. She knows the techniques of stitchery very well and became popular in her street. For meeting the demands of her customers, she needs to purchase more raw materials. Therefore, she contacted Kashf Foundation for the second time and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more spools of threads, buttons, lace and needles. In this way, she would be able to complete orders without delay, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She wishes to provide a quality education to her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, buttons, lace and needles.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Ms Kaneez has been doing a stitching business for many years. She initiated her business after separating from her husband in order to bear her own expenses instead of becoming a burden on her family members. She has gained 10 years of experience in this field and has maintained a good client list. She is known for the best stitching in her community. 

She needs to purchase more stitching material for completing orders on time. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. This will help her to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, lace and zippers in various colors. She has been in association with Kashf for two years. She expects an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons, lace and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 57-year-old mixed-crop farmer. He is a widower with four children. He has been in the farming business for the past thirteen years and has a monthly income of KES15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Gabriel will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will pay for his children's education. His hopes and dreams are to venture into a zero-grazing farm business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 20 years old from the small village of Martvili district. He lives with his wife and 2 infant children. Otar has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his ow income and his family’s poor living conditions.
