The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and 0.5 hectare agricultural land, where 200 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. The money earned is barely enough to feed the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Otar has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Otar will purchase a car. After purchasing the car, Otar plans to buy groceries in Kutaisi to transport to his village for resale at a  better price. He will be able to increase the income of his family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-Up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out a new loan to expand her food vending business because demand has risen for the pasr few weeks. She does not want to disappoint her clients, so she wants to make new investments so that she can offer a variety of food in her food stall. Fatuma says that since her previous loans, her income has been gradually increasing hence improving the quality of life for her family. She needs to buy more ingredients which is why she is asking for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, vegetables, meat, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 34 years old  and a mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Francis, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 11,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Faith will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children.  

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will increase her monthly income, improving the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. She operates a farm where she sells farm produce. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a very productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the poor infrastructure of road network to her business farm. She will use the loan of KES 8,700 to purchase a water tank.  Her business goal is to buy additional land within five years.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 32-year-old businesswoman. She is single but supports her parents. She has been selling charcoal for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to take care of her basic needs. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Irene will use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand the business. Her hope is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is a 28-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are both schooling. He has been in farming for over seven years producing eggs and vegetables, which he sells at the market in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will later sell the products and earn extra income to help him boost his livelihood and to pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to be raising more than 1,000 poultry birds in the next five years.

The high cost of feed is his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29-year-old farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya where she lives with one child. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years producing coffee, peas, milk and eggs, which she sells at the market in her local area.

She is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will sell the products and use the money to pay school fees for her child, improve her living standards and expand her poultry farming. She aspires to be the leading supplier of eggs in her area.

The high cost of feed is her major challenge in farming.

Lucy is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Mugusu Twimuke Tukole Group

texts.en:
Henry is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. He is a twenty-six-year-old hardworking man with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He trades agricultural produce, rears animals, and also practices farming. 

His personal goals are educating his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications, and building a permanent house, as he is currently in a semi-permanent dwelling. His business plans are to own a food store and venture into commercialized agriculture.

Henry is requesting the loan to buy produce to sell, such as beans and maize.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell, such as beans and maize.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 12 years to 24 years. She describes herself as creative and a risk taker. 

She operates a farm where she sells farm produce that is produced during the harvesting, such as tomatoes, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

She will use the 8,700 KES loan to purchase a water tank, which will be used by her family members. 

Her business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will increase her farm production .

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Kassimu

texts.en: Kassimu, 45, is married and has four children. He lives in the rural area of Msambweni. He’s worked in agriculture since he was a gentleman and has been growing a variety of crops including corn, bananas, and pawpaw, among others, for about three years now. He sells his products in local markets in the town. He’s currently asking for a KES 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer and manure and pay for labor costs. He hopes to get better crop yields and to prepare the soil better because his plan is that his crops improve each season and produce profits so he can live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and pay labor costs

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Benadette is a 35-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Joseph, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for 11 years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans on time. Benadette will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she plans to buy a dairy cow.  Her hopes are to own a big tea farm, which will improve the living standards of her fa

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Immaculle

texts.en:
Immaculle is 52 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 25 years old and youngest is 17. 

She has been in business for 12 years and she needs a loan to buy more sorghum for making traditional drinks. 

With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to make more traditional soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 48 years old. She is a widow with three children. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is six years old. Eugenie has been in business for one year. She wants a loan to buy more sorghum to sell. The profit will pay for school fees and help her take care of her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is married with seven children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is seven years old. She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more salt, sugar, cooking oil and soap. The profit will assist her to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores de 61 años de edad, casada  con cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Ella es originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Dolores es persona que se destaca por su amabilidad, responsabilidad, tenacidad de trabajo. Y gracias a su espíritu de perseverancia  tiene por actividad económica venta de leña, nacatamales (comida típica de la región) y fresco.  En un lugar establecido en su comunidad, desde hace 15 años que desempeña la actividad que hasta la fecha ha sido su medio de vida, y su forma de obtener ingresos. La rutina diaria de dolores es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias elaborando y vendiendo sus diferentes productos como nacatamales, frescos naturales. Ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su puntualidad en los pagos en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima para la elaboración del nacatamal como cerdos, condimentos, hojas de nacatamal, leña, gas,papas, arroz y frutas como pina, bananos, sandias, naranjas, cálalas. Dolores agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dolores is 61 years old, married, and has four adult children.  She is from Malpaisillo, a place located in the western zone of the country.  Dolores is a person known for her friendliness, responsibility, and dedication to her work and to her perseverance in her sales of firewood, nacatamales (typical food of the region) and fresh drinks.  She works in an establishment she set up in her community 15 years ago and up to now this has been her way of making a living.

Her daily routine is to work 10 hours daily making and selling her different products like nacatamales, and natural drinks.  She has worked with the foundation before and has a demonstrated on time payment record.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make her nacatamales, such as pork, condiments, nacatamal leaves, firewood, gas, potatoes, rice, and fruit like pineapple, bananas, watermelon, oranges, and calalas.  Dolores is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who help people in poor countries like Nicaragua had a dignified means of working.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma, 39, lives with her husband and their four children in a house they own. She has been selling food for six months now, which has helped her to become well-known and earn clients over time. Her sales are very stable and she wishes to improve them significantly. Fatuma has requested a loan from Yehu, Kiva's field partner, for money to purchase staple grains, meat, flour, sugar, and vegetables. This will help her increase the quantity and variety of food she can offer. In this way, Fatuma can give better service to her customers, who will be very satisfied and will give positive feedback about her business, thus gaining new clients, which will be even more beneficial for her.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, meat, flour, sugar, and vegetables.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura has been selling firewood for several years but she has decided to open a food stall to supplement her income. She says it is doing well. She has established a good clientele base. Zuhura is happy that she has many regular customers. At times sells to them on credit. Her aim is to own a hotel in the future. She is thankful for the support that she has gotten from Kiva and Yehu, which have helped her to have a dignified life. She intends to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en: Leatitia is 34 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 13 years old and the youngest is one. Her husband is a motorcyclist. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more sorghum, corn, peanuts etc. She will keep the profits in her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, corn, and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with two children. The oldest is five years old and the youngest is two and one half years old.  Her husband is a farmer. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more rice and beans. The profit will pay for her kids’ school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Kabingo Women Association Group

texts.en: Damazo is a 30-year-old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not help him meet the day-to-day needs, he decided to start a produce and general merchandise retail shop. Price fluctuation is his major challenge while his dream is to trade at wholesale. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. Damazo intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra de 38 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad, área metropolitana de Barranquilla con sus dos hijos de 15 y 18 años. Allí se dedica a generar ingresos mediante la venta de mercancía en miscelánea o punto comercial, ubicado en su propio domicilio.  Sus principales productos son la ropa, el calzado, los cosméticos y la papelería, los cuales vende de contado, a clientes del barrio y de sus alrededores, de lunes a domingo, iniciando desde las 9 de la mañana y terminando a las 9 de la noche o más, si es necesario. Inicialmente surgió a Sandra la idea de vender mercancía hace 8 años y por eso optó por incorporarse a una multinacional, para vender sus productos mediante catálogos o guías especializadas de productos. Poco a poco con sus ganancia, fue comprando vitrinas y luego su propio local,  en el que aun se encuentra y desde el cual distribuye sus productos, de contado  al consumidor final  que le compra al detal. Últimamente ofrece servicios de comunicaciones  por minutos, lo cual genera un nuevo ingreso y así aprovecha su clientela doméstica con el fin de activar ambos negocios. Su meta es lograr una gran variedad de productos y ubicar un nuevo punto comercial o sucursal,  con este mismo concepto. Su capacidad de comprar, para satisfacer la creciente demanda cada vez es menor, pero sus deseos de crecer son persistentes y por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Calzado, y ropa principalmente, pues desea que su clientela esté bien elegante celebrando la navidad y el año nuevo en familia y se sientan satisfechos con la compra realizada en su negocio ; esto es lo que justamente hace que su credikiva tenga éxito: que Sandra conoce el mercado y sabe como accionar en el para hace negociaciones yo gano tu ganas.
texts.en: Sandra, 38 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla with her two children, 15 and 18 years old. There she earns income by selling merchandise in a general store or business located in her own house. Her main products are clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and stationery, which she sells on a cash basis to customers from the neighborhood and surrounding areas every day starting at 9 in the morning and ending at 9 in the evening or later, if necessary. The idea of selling merchandise initially came to Sandra 8 years ago, and because of this she chose to join up with a multinational company to sell its products through catalogues or specialized product guides. Little by little she bought display cases with her earnings, and then her own premises, in which she can still be found and from which she distributes her products in cash to the end customer who buys it at retail. Lately she has been offering communication services by the minute, which generates new income. In this way she makes the most of her land line customers with the goal of boosting both businesses. Her goal is to achieve a wide variety of products and find a new place of business or branch with this same concept. Her capacity to buy in order to satisfy the growing demand is getting smaller and smaller, but her desire to grow is persistent. Therefore, she is taking out a Kiva loan, the first financing she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy mainly shoes and clothing, since she wants her customers to be really elegant when celebrating Christmas and the New Year with family, and for them to be satisfied with the purchases made at her business. This is just what will make her Kiva loan successful: Sandra knows the market and knows how to take action in it to engage in win-win negotiations.

loans.use: to buy mainly shoes and clothing

loans.name: Domina

texts.en: Domina is 25 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is three years old and the youngest is six months old. She has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as corn flour, sugar, and rice. With the profit she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Amudani

texts.en: Amudani is a 40-year-old married hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a bar. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. An insufficient power supply affects his business while his plan is to buy a standby generator and diversify his business to offer other services. Like all good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University level. Amudani intends to use the loan to buy a generator and construct a video hall.

loans.use: to buy a generator and construct a video hall.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 27 years old. He is single. He has been in business for four years. He wants a loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap and rice. With the profit, he will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and soaps to sell

loans.name: Josine

texts.en: Josine is 23 years old. She is married with one child who is two years old. Her husband is a security guard. She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more of three different brands of second hand clothing to sell. The profit will be placed into her savings.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Gisele

texts.en: Gisele is married with three children. The oldest child is six years old, and the youngest is three years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in business for 10 years. She wants a loan to buy more food items. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatice is 40 years old. She is a widow with one child. The child is 20 years old. She wants a loan to buy more food items to sell in her retail store. With the profit, she will pay for her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: María Del Rocío

texts.en: María del Rocio has always worked in the agricultural sector, focusing on innovation and sustainable development. She feels it is of utmost importance for farmers like herself to implement strategies and technologies to reduce the negative environmental impact stemming from raising animals and crops. She also notes that it is imperative for her to actively serve as an example or role model within the community. As a result, she is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce ground water contamination from her animal waste, to generate renewable biogas to cover her energy needs, and to produce potent organic fertilizer, allowing her to grow crops without excessive agrochemical fertilizer usage. This loan represents 93% of the total cost of María del Rocio's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children whose ages range from 10 years to 18 years. She describes herself as self-reliant and hard working. She runs an agribusiness where she sells tomatoes, onions, beans, and fruits like bananas, melons, and mangoes. She also has a retail business selling water to customers. 

Monicah has had this business for eight years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a busy market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the outbreak of crop diseases, which affect her business greatly. She will use the loan of 11,100 KES to purchase a water tank, which will be used by her family members on household chores.

Her business goal is to expand her business and generate more income within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business with the help of financial support through SMEP DTM, Kiva's field partner.

loans.use: to purchase a water harvesting tank.

loans.name: Kiraaro Twekambe Group

texts.en: Robert is a member of the above group, where members guarantee each other to access a loan. In order to supplement his farming activities he decided to venture into a retail shop business. With the proceeds he has been able to meet his family's basic needs. Bad debts and price fluctuation are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Robert intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Xavera

texts.en: Xavera is 22 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is three years old, and the youngest is one years old. Her husband is a technician. She wants a loan to buy more items for her store. The profits will be added to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro, a dairy farmer from Tlaxcala, is constantly looking to reduce his operating costs. The price of milk on the open market is volatile, and the LP gas required to produce value-added products like yogurt and cheese is expensive. With his 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Alejandro will be able to generate clean-burning, renewable biogas from the hundreds of kilograms of manure his cows produce weekly, allowing him to significantly decrease his energy costs. Moreover, he will use the fertilizer generated by the system on his animal feed - maize and alfalfa - allowing him to save on agrochemical fertilizer costs. This loan represents 43% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen con su anterior credikiva compró una fileteadora industrial, telas, hilos, correderas, botones  etc. Carmen dice que su anterior financiamiento fue de gran ayuda, para que las prendas tuvieran un excelente acabado y sus clientes se sintieran muy satisfechos, lo cual le ha abierto nuevos mercados. Desde que recibió su credikiva sus ventas han aumentado y han mejorado su situación económica. En la actualidad quiere  mejorar su productividad y por eso necesita una máquina recubridora de uso industrial, ideal para la costura de mangas y pantalones. Su credikiva tendrá éxito porque con él aumentará la calidad de sus costuras y su diversificación de productos se incrmentará. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Agradecida con las personas que nos prestan a nosotros los pequeños comerciantes y deseo que sigan con esta linda labor. "
texts.en: Carmen used her previous Kiva loan to buy an industrial filleting machine, fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.  Carmen says that the previous loan was a great help so that the clothing would have excellent finishing touches and her customers would be very satisfied.  This has opened new markets for her.  Since receiving her Kiva loan her sales have increased and her financial situation has improved.  Now she wants to improve her productivity so she needs an industrial recovering machine, ideal for making sleeves and pants.  Her Kiva loan will be a success because she will be able to increase quality and diversify her products more.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “I’m grateful to those who lend to us, the small businesses, and I hope you continue doing this wonderful work.”

loans.use: to buy a recovering machine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is four years old and the youngest is three years old. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, alcohol, and soda. With the profit she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, bread, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks and cosmetics.
